title: Data Architect - Analytics Platform
Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader, eager to take charge and drive projects forward. You are highly experienced, with a knack for staying ahead in your field, constantly seeking opportunities for growth and development. Your expertise enables you to navigate complex environments with ease, making you a valuable asset to any project.

Why Join Us?

Joining our team means being part of an organization that values innovation and leadership. We offer a dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact our success and the success of our clients. This role is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills, work on challenging projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**  

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*  

  

**Role Overview**  

BDR Solutions, LLC seeks a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team. The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into the written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations.
* Apply analytics, problem-solving, and communication skills to identify best-fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposals to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.
* Architect and design innovative, cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.
* Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and standards on business and technical solutions.
* Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients.
* Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies.
* Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.
* Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings.
* Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs
* Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments.
* Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meetings, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.
* Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.
* Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.
* Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development.

**Required Minimum Qualifications*** Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years of experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.).
* In-depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including the ability to take part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication.

**Ideal Experience*** Proven experience working in a pace environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3.
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating clearly orally and in writing, and producing high-quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers


In addition, U.S. citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.  

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.  

  

  

**About BDR Solutions:**  

  

BDR Solutions delivers IT expertise and solutions that improve American lives through the modernization of government systems for health benefits, social services, and disaster relief. We are a service-disabled veteran-owned, 8(a), HUBZone small business—recognized for reliable and sustainable outcomes scaled to our client’s mission needs.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
A Solutions Architect in Brightcove's Global Services (BGS) team is adept at presenting technical solutions to address customer and prospect business requirements. The role will consist of engaging to understand customer challenges then illustrating and presenting highly scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud architectures that both address their needs and accelerate the adoption of Brightcove products and services. You will help customers and prospects define complete end-to-end solutions that leverage Brightcove products, 3rd party products, and custom solutions built by BGS. You'll prepare technical documentation and perform detailed discovery workshops to fully understand customer use-cases and requirements. You will also help develop Proof-of-Concepts to both help sell and close opportunities.



We are looking for someone who is passionate about media and video who can take leadership in interacting with publishers and content owners on a technical level. The candidate must be highly motivated, extremely technical, team-oriented, creative, and possess outstanding communication skills. You will be asked to maintain working knowledge of engineering and complex aspects of our products and answer complex questions on functionality and usage.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Develop a deep understanding of customers' goals and objectives and translate that knowledge into clear and effective technical documentation.
* Communicate and drive highly complex technology solutions to broad audiences within and outside of IT through diagrams, written and verbal presentations and communication.
* Work with customers' senior leadership and within Brightcove to make sure the customers' needs are met with our professional services solutions.
* Develop technical solutions for client-specific use cases.
* Work with Brightcove internal stakeholders (i.e., Product, Management, Support, etc.) to ensure solution designs can be maintained and supported for the long-term success of our customers.
* Travel when necessary to meet customers.
* Remain up-to-date on cutting edge technologies and effectively incorporate that knowledge into solution designs that best solve our customers' needs.
* Work with the Brightcove Services Engineering team to come up with cost estimates and levels of effort.


**Qualifications/Experience**


* 8+ years of experience working with customers in a technical presales capacity.
* Experience in streaming media or video space is a must.
* Must be self-sufficient to drive multiple opportunities independently, under supervision from a senior team member.
* Experience selling and implementing technology to earn a customer's trust.
* Understand video industry technologies including Authentication/Authorization systems, OSS/BSS systems, analytics collection, advertising, and payment gateways.
* Solid level of video industry acumen; keeps current with trends and able to converse with clients on issues and challenges.
* Experience architecting complex, highly available, and highly scalable web applications.
* A demonstrated ability of working with customers to understand their business requirements as well as their technical requirements, then have the ability to clearly document them to internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
* Experience creatively architecting solutions tying in multiple disparate technologies to solve a customer's unique business problem.
* Demonstrated ability to articulate and sell the benefits of modern platforms, software, and technologies.
* Demonstrated ability to present to both technical and non-technical audiences, and be able to handle objections extemporaneously.
* A history of successful customer relations done by developing an understanding of what made a difference, devising architectures that helped meet a goal, tackle a problem, or outpace competitors.
* Comfortable creating technical documentation, including Technical Design Documents, Solution Documents, and Technical Specifications.
* Excellent written, oral, presentation, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Demonstrated experience with client-side tools and technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, in-browser debugging, etc.); knowledge of client side frameworks such as React, VueJS, or Angular a plus.
* Proficiency with at least one server-side language (Python, Node.js, Java, etc.) required.
* Experience with cloud deployment technologies required; AWS technologies (ECS, Lambda, APIGateway) strongly preferred.
* Experience working with OVP and Mobile solutions preferred.
* Experience with native mobile app development a plus.
* Experience with AppleTV, Roku, AndroidTV, or Chromecast development a plus.


**About Brightcove**



Brightcove is a diverse, global team of smart, passionate people who are revolutionizing the way organizations deliver video. We're hyped up about storytelling, and about helping organizations reach their audiences in bold and innovative ways. When video is done right, it can have a powerful and lasting effect. Hearts open. Minds change.



Since 2004, Brightcove has been supporting customers that are some of the largest media companies, enterprises, events, and non-profit organizations in the world. There are over 600 Brightcovers globally, each of us representing our unique talents and we have built a culture that values authenticity, individual empowerment, excellence and collaboration. This culture enables us to harness the incredible power of video and create an environment where you will want to grow, stay and thrive. Bottom line: We take our video seriously, and we take great pride in doing it as #oneteam.


**WORKING AT BRIGHTCOVE**



We strive to provide our employees with an environment where they can do their best work and be their best selves. This includes a focus on our employees' work experience, actively creating a culture where inclusion and growth are at the center, and hiring, recognizing, promoting employees who are committed to living and breathing these same ideals. We value collaboration, creativity, work/life balance, professional growth and creating an empowering space for open communication. Whether you're in one of our offices around the world or working remotely you have plenty of opportunities to meet colleagues and celebrate a variety of personal interests with organized groups and clubs including an Employee Action Committee, Women of Brightcove, Pride of Brightcove, Parents of Brightcove … and more to come!


*We recognize that no candidate is perfect and Brightcove would love to have the chance to get to know you. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. Brightcove embraces diversity and seeks candidates who support persons of all identities and backgrounds. We strongly encourage individuals from underrepresented and/or marginalized identities to apply. If you need any accommodations for your interview, please email* *recruiting@brightcove.com**.*


*The Brightcove* *Privacy Policy* *explains the processing and purposes of any personal information.*


*BC21027*


*#LI-Remote*


At Brightcove, we believe that providing comprehensive and competitive compensation and benefits packages across the globe are essential to our employees. Base salary is just one component of Brightcove's total rewards program. We offer a wide range of benefits and perks that may include bonus or commission, Brightcove stock, unlimited paid time off, 401(K) matching, health insurance (medical, dental, and vision), generous employer Health Savings Account (HSA) contributions, tuition reimbursement, 100% paid parental leave and more.

title: AI Architect
description:
**Position: AI Architect**

**Location: Remote (EST/CST)**

**Duration: Contract**

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AI and machine learning algorithms and the ability to design, develop and deploy AI solutions that address business problems. They will have excellent programming skills and be proficient in at least one of the major programming languages used in AI such as Python, Java, or C++.

**Responsibilities:**

· Collaborate with data scientists and other AI professionals to augment digital transformation efforts by identifying and piloting use cases.

· Align technical implementation with existing and future requirements by gathering inputs from multiple stakeholders — business users, data scientists, security professionals, data engineers and analysts, and those in IT operations

· Design and develop AI and machine learning algorithms and models that meet business requirements

· Strong knowledge of deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch

· Develop scalable and efficient algorithms and models that can be deployed in production environments

· Extensive knowledge of Big Data solutions like Apache Shark, Apache Hadoop, SQL, and NoSQL databases.

· Clear understanding of the workflow and pipeline architectures of deep learning and machine learning workloads. Should also have an in-depth knowledge of the components and architectural trade-offs involved in the model building, governance, deployment, and production of workflows.

· Evaluate and improve existing AI solutions to ensure optimal performance and accuracy

· Develop and maintain documentation for AI-based solutions

· Develop and implement best practices for data management and model training

· Conduct experiments and analyses to evaluate the performance of AI solutions

· Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud

· Familiarity with data analysis tools such as SQL, Tableau, or PowerBI

**Soft Skills:**

· Effectively communicate thoughts, insights and plans to cross-functional teams. Should have ability to

explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders like business unit executives

· Excellent presentation skills to engage with business users to gain an in-depth understanding of priorities and needs

· Provide expert advice to determine options and solutions to project issues and challenges to ensure optimal service delivery and client satisfaction.

**Good to Have:**

· Good to have experience in implementing AI use cases for Contact Centres

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* AI architect: 4 years (Preferred)
* SQL: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. VMware Cloud Engineer
description:
**THE ROLE: Senior VMware Cloud Engineer**

**Location: Remote (United States)**

**Experience: 7 + yrs**

**Position type : Full time**

**Job Summary:**

As a Sr. VMware Cloud Engineer, you will work on a team to ensure execution excellence and create supreme customer experiences for all assigned projects. The Sr. VMware Cloud Engineer combines technical ability and experience with polished communication skills to deploy VMware solutions on cloud platforms. This position reports to the Sr. Director of VMware Cloud Services.

**Travel Requirements:**

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 5%. This is a work-from-home role with the option to use local Presidio office (if available).

**Job Responsibilities:**

Work with a team of engineers on client projects and on-going professional services engagements.

Design and implement a VMware Cloud solutions for clients.

Deliver VMware Cloud workshops for customers.

Lead customer engagments to identify and manage workload migrations.

Post implementation support and troubleshooting for clients on occasion.

Technical writing skills to author professional documentation for client review.

Authoring logical and physical diagrams using Microsoft Visio (or equivalent).

Ability to track and enter time spent into required systems on a timely basis.

Leading conversations and white boarding sessions in front of clients and/or peers.

**Required Skills:**

Demonstrated work experience with VMware workloads

Experience with cloud platforms like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure or Google Cloud Paltform (GCP)

Strong work experience migrating data center workloads within VMware (P2V, vMotion, HCX, etc)

Experience configuring and troubleshooting VMware technologies like HCX, vSAN, NSX-T, vCenter, and Aria Operations​

Ability to work as a team or on their own depending on the engagement and ability to keep yourself on task.

Ability to work on multiple projects, prioritize work, and meet timelines

Ability to properly diagram and document a working environment.

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Experience with VMware tools like VMware Site Recovery Manager (SRM)/VMware Site Recovery(VSR) and VMware Cloud Disaster Recovery (VCDR).

Strong communication to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders

Experience with cloud storage solutions from Microsoft, AWS, NetApp, Pure, Dell and others

Experience with VMware Enterprise products (VCP preferred but not required) 

Experience with Veeam, Commvault or other data protection solutions

Strong work ethic and problem-solving skills.

Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

Self-motivated and a desire to succeed.

Ability to physically lift and install equipment.

Experience with DHCP, DNS and general network troubleshooting.

Experience with general backup and disaster recovery technologies.

Experienced working with multiple data centers and concepts around high availability, replication, and RTO/RPO.

Relentless attention to detail.

Technical certifications are strongly desired.

Ability to travel as needed.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience and/or military experience

6+ years of advanced working VMware knowledge and experience working with data center and workload migrations.

3+ years of work experience in developing workload migration plans

title: Principal Cloud Architect
description:
About the job:

Configure Red Hat software products in combination to create an OpenStack environment for the Red Hat Learning Platform team. Design and deploy the infrastructure to support the OpenStack environment, including IdM, Satellite, Ansible, Ceph, Object Storage, Guacamole.* Telecommuting role to be performed anywhere in the U.S.


What you will do:

Coordinate with other internal and external teams to gather and provide features for the online lab environment.
Evaluate and recommend software and hardware updates for the environment.
Provide a level-3 support by helping to diagnose and fix issues with the environment.
Deploy environments and help the Cloud Architects architect and design these environments.
Design, deploy and maintain automation scripts using bash or Ansible.
Design, deploy and maintain networks in the cloud environment, making recommendations for current and future projects, and diagnosing, troubleshooting, and fixing issues with internal and external networks.
Analyze consumer utilization and provide recommended upgrades and expansion needed to meet projected targets.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and address issues in the environment using feedback from the support teams.  

The salary range for this position is $125,760 - $207,530. Actual offer will be based on your qualifications.
What you will bring:

Bachelor’s degree (U.S. or foreign equivalent) in Computer Science, Systems Engineering or related field and seven (7) years of experience in the job offered or related role.
Must have seven (7) years of experience with: designing, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting Red Hat Identity Manager (IdM), MultiMaster replication and integrating with other solutions for Identity as a service; designing, deploying and maintaining VM’s with RHV; troubleshooting and addressing issues with the RHV cluster and recommending and enforcing best practices for users using the RHV cluster; customizing deployments using Ansible or bash scripts in medium to large environments; designing, deploying and maintaining automation scripts using bash or Ansible; and designing, deploying and maintaining networks in virtual, cloud and physical environments.
Must have six (6) years of experience with: designing, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting Red Hat Ceph Storage in a medium to large environment and diagnosing and addressing issues with the Ceph Clusters and its interconnected pieces; designing, deploying and maintaining RHOSP using Director in medium to large environment; core OpenStack services; and OpenStack backup and recovery procedures.
Must have five (5) years of experience with: configuring CEPH storage mirroring and replication between clusters and regions; designing, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform (OCP) in a medium to large environment; designing, deploying and maintaining OCP on the Red Hat OpenStack Platform Cloud, customizing the deployments using Ansible or bash scripts and diagnosing, troubleshooting, and addressing issues with the OCP environment; designing, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting VyOS and Vyatta in a medium to large, load-based environment; deploying and fixing issues with the networking layer between VyOS, OpenStack, and the external network, using multicast, VRRP, HA, IPSec VPN, routing, and other features of VyOS; and analyzing consumer utilization and providing recommended upgrades and expansion needed to meet projected targets.
Must have three (3) years of experience designing, installing, maintaining, and troubleshooting Guacamole for VNC connections in a medium to large, distributed and load balanced environment.
Domestic and international travel required up to 10% of the time to conferences and client sites. Travel expenses covered by Red Hat, Inc.

title: AWS Solutions Architect - Fully Remote
description:
DLZP Group is looking for a talented hands-on AWS Solutions Architect to help advance our growing Cloud Services business. This is an excellent opportunity to join DLZP's world class technical teams, working with hard-working, motivated and creative engineers, while also developing your skills and furthering your career within an innovative focused leader of AWS technologies.  

  

You will demonstrate technical skills in software development and cloud architectures as well as customer facing skills at all levels of a customer organization. You should also be able to think thoughtfully about business, product, and technical challenges. As a member of the DLZP Solutions Architect team, you will act as a trusted adviser to our managed systems customers.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

  

* Analyze current technologies used within the company and determine ways to improve
* Document and monitor requirements needed to institute proposed updates
* Work closely with Information Technology professionals within the company to ensure the hardware is available for projects and working properly
* Propose and establish a framework for necessary contributions from various departments
* Account for possible project challenges on constraints including, risks, time, resources, and scope
* Work in collaboration with project management teams to successfully monitor the progress of initiatives
* Provide detailed specifications and diagrams for proposed solutions
* Define clear goals for all aspects of a project and manage their proper execution
* Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful engagements worldwide
* Assist customers with the definition of technical strategies that will enable them to migrate more of their systems onto the AWS platform
* Capture and share AWS best practice knowledge with our broader Solution Architect community
* Share customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive the future of DLZP
* Work as the technical leader to provide the customer business and technical solutions
* Serve as a technical advisor for business application initiatives by participating in the evaluation, planning, design, and implementation of new applications

**Qualifications**  

  

* 3+ years of hands-on AWS implementation or consulting experience
* 3+ years in customer and/or partner-facing roles utilizing AWS
* 3+ years of experience with AWS development and architectural hands-on consulting experience
* Project management and leadership skills
* Experienced in developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
* Knowledge of software engineering and design architecture
* BA/BS degree or related work experience required
* AWS Solutions Architect: Associate certification
* Ability to travel

**Additional Preferred Skills**  

  

* Hands-on experience with AWS services like; EC2, RDS, Elastic Container services, Load Balancers, Route 53, and Cloud Formation
* Positive outlook in meeting challenges and working to take initiative and produce results
* Understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
* Professional experience working with and analyzing computer hardware and software
* Knowledge of and experience working with operating systems
* Experience working with end-user or developer communities
* Experience working across internal and external organizations
* Experience on Orchestration tools like Ansible is a plus.
* Knowledgeable of the software development lifecycle and has the skills to handle the software development lifecycle independently.
* Ability to quickly learn new technology and applications
* Ability to write infrastructure as code and experience on Cloud Formation platform.
* Familiarity with Oracle products is a plus
* AWS Solutions Architect - Associate required, Professional certification preferred

**Must be a U.S. Citizen and U.S.-based.**  

  

**An Equal Opportunity Employer**  

This is a remote position.

title: Cloud Solutions Architect (AWS)
description:
We are looking for a Full-time contractor or employee for a Cloud Solutions Architect.

As part of client IT Applications – Social Services Applications initiatives, the Cloud Solution Architect 2 will be responsible for:

Creating and leading IT system integration processes to meet the organization’s needs

Conducting regular evaluations of the system architecture and collaborating with project management teams to improve the designs

Evaluating any project constraints and devising alternatives to reduce risks, whilst performing process re-engineering

Analysing and finding any impacts that that technical changes may have on a client’s business proceeding

Planning and engineering of an organization's cloud computing infrastructure and applications. Implements and designs infrastructure and software.

* Defining and developing blueprints and roadmaps for building solutions in the cloud
* Ensuring solutions are engineered and deployed in the cloud.
* Building roadmap for cloud Strategy, implementation and monitoring
* Ensuring compliance with enterprise security configuration standards
* Providing Production support and ensuring system is up and running.
* Providing operational guidance both internal to the team, and for external operations teams
* Performing continuous research on emerging technologies to stay updated with the best alternatives, investigate and provide feedback on new services and solutions offered by the CSP
* Providing technical oversight, review, and quality control throughout the life cycle of the implementations
* Engaging with Cloud service provider around solving technical problems in the Cloud ecosystem
* Supporting DevOps functions to best utilize cloud resources with software configuration management and continuous integration tools.
* Leading and ensuring HHSC best practices and methodologies are applied to the design, deployment, and operations in the cloud. The Cloud Solution Architect will perform other duties as assigned.

**Education:**

Graduation from an accredited four-year college or university with major course work in computer science, computer information systems, engineering, or management information systems is preferred.

**Certification:**

* Cloud Solutions Architect Certification
* Cloud Infrastructure Certifications

**Skills(Required) :**

* Hands on experience in designing, executing, and supporting IT cloud solutions.
* Experience with technical architecture, cloud platform development, cloud strategy, IT strategy, and infrastructure strategy
* Hands-on development experience implementing applications utilizing any J2EE Application Server, Authentication and Authorization, Caching strategies
* Hands-on programming experience in the following languages: Java, J2EE, HTML5, JavaScript, JQuery, AJAX, CSS3, Bootstrap, SASS, Angular, Typescript, Spring, Java Server Pages, JSON, XML, ES5/ES6, NPM, Maven and/or other UI frameworks/libraries.
* Experience implementing Client-facing applications with responsive design and development
* Experience implementing SPA (Single Page Applications) with JS or with libraries/frameworks like Angular
* Experience in development of self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components
* Experience in Test-driven development and test creation using frameworks such as Katalon, Karma, Jasmine, Selenium
* Experience developing, optimizing, and maintaining an enterprise-level Angular application including complete ownership of the front-end stack (JavaScript/Angular/HTML/CSS).
* Experience with implementing the best practices in application design, performance, scalability, and maintainability.
* Experience with deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Docker, Kubernetes, EKS, OpenShift)
* Hands-on experience participating in all phases of Agile development
* Experience with cloud technology, including Software as a Service (SaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), or Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).
* Hands-on experience with adjacent technology areas including Security, Identity / Access Management and Monitoring.
* Experience with virtualized environments (VMware vSphere 5.x) and knowledge of provisioning hardware, storage, resources, and configuration/administration, including high-availability and failover services for cloud infrastructure.

**Skills(Preferred) :**

* Hands-on experience with IBM WebSphere Application Server 8 or later and JBOSS
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD methodology
* Hands-on development experience for mobile and tablet platforms.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $100.00 - $110.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: SOLUTIONS ARCHITECT
description:
Location: North Dallas or Santa Clara, CA


Salary Range: $125,000- $150,000/yr


Department: Field Engineering & Customer Integration


We are seeking an experienced Solutions Architect to join our team in deploying the next generation of Identity and Access Management technology – Continuous Adaptive Trust. As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for pre-sales designing, post-sales implementing, and integration of our passwordless and continuous authentication solutions. You will work closely with our sales, development, and project management teams to ensure that our solutions align with client requirements and industry best practices.


**Responsibilities**:


* Collaborate with sales teams to identify and understand client requirements and propose appropriate solutions within our client environments.
* Design and architect solutions, including hardware, software, and network components, that meet client needs and align with industry best practices.
* Develop detailed solution architecture documents, including system diagrams, network diagrams, and technical specifications.
* Provide guidance and oversight to development teams to ensure that solutions are implemented according to the agreed-upon architecture.
* Identify and mitigate risks associated with solution design and implementation.
* Communicate technical concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry best practices, and recommend new technologies and methodologies to improve our solutions.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect, with a minimum of 5-10 years of mid-senior level experience in designing and implementing complex IT solutions.
* Strong understanding of Identity and Access Management, cloud-based architectures, and
* containerization technologies.
* Experience with various development frameworks.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
* Relevant certifications such as AWS Solutions Architect are a plus.


If you are a highly motivated and experienced Solutions Architect looking for an exciting new opportunity, please submit your resume and cover letter for consideration. This position may require frequent travel within and outside of the United States.


TruU is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and do not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Funnel Leasing Inc.,** is hiring for a **Solutions Architect** that can '**work from anywhere' in the U.S.** As a **Solutions Architect**, you will play a crucial role in addressing customers' complex business challenges. You will be responsible for translating business requirements into scalable and sustainable technical solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly cross-functional role at Funnel. Our Solutions team is our technical hub and trusty conduit between customer and company.


**Why Funnel?**  

We are a 'work from anywhere' in the U.S. SaaS company that centers our services on the renter experience. We develop amazing software that has revolutionized the #proptech industry. And did we mention we have an amazing team that is on #FunnelFire!? Oh, did we forget to tell you we have unlimited PTO, benefits that begin on your first day of employment, P.I.N.K. core values that ROCK, and our team puts the FUN in Funnel!


Employees may be eligible for various benefits. Generally, we provide employee access to:


* Health insurance
* Dental and Vision insurance
* Company paid Life/AD&D
* Long-term Disability insurance
* Short-term Disability insurance
* Term Life insurance
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Retirement Plan - 2% company match
* EAP


In addition to these benefits, we also offer


* Benefits effective on first date of employment
* Remote-first; work from anywhere within the US company culture
* Uncapped Discretionary Time off
* Sick Leave
* 13 paid holidays
* One time remote work stipend
* Employee recognition program
* Employee-led Groups (ELG's)


**Who is Funnel Leasing?**


Have you ever rented an apartment and wished the process could be better? At Funnel we do too. We know we need to make the process of renting an apartment as easy as purchasing socks on Amazon. We've created cloud-based marketing and leasing software that delivers the ultimate rental experience for everyone involved in the process. We're in the process of transforming the real estate industry through cutting-edge technology built, sold, and supported by the most passionate people you'll meet.


Click here (https://funnelleasing.com/) to learn more about Funnel and our innovative team members across the country.  



The **Solutions Architect I's** essential roles and responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:


* Collaborate closely with internal teams, including product, engineering, support, and finance, to ensure alignment and successful execution of customer initiatives.
* Independently develop and proactively provide account strategies significant to our clients supported by your knowledge of property management industry trends, emerging technologies, and applicable regulatory changes
* Be conversant in our clients' business needs and the industry. Develop a mastery and an ability to keep up with our rapidly changing tech capabilities.
* Deliver results autonomously with minimal direction or guidance
* Ability to navigate, influence, and communicate with poise to CxO/VP level and senior technical stakeholders (both internally/externally)
* Distill and translate highly technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders to drive intended outcomes
* Develop a deep understanding of Funnel Leasing's software solutions and become a trusted expert in our product offerings.
* Consult with Funnel customers to provide operating best practices that maximize the value they can achieve from Funnel's software.
* Maintain and cultivate strong client relationships, ensuring satisfaction and loyalty through proactive communication and attentive service.


**Culture**


* Create a culture of continuous improvement and learning for individual professional development
* Foster collaboration within team and across the company
* Performs other duties as assigned and modified at manager's discretion


**Education, Work Experience, Knowledge, and Certifications**


* 2+ years at a SaaS technology company
* Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or similar role
* Experience conceptualizing and documenting system and process flows within an API-based integration environment
* Experience overcoming technical or change management barriers through a consultative mindset
* Ability to deliver on complex projects with competing and nuanced priorities


*Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Funnel, we are committed to building a proptech company that is as diverse as the multifamily industry we serve, and that means to not only live our inclusivity, but also to support and encourage it among all society. If you are excited about this role but your past experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.*


**Travel**: <5%


**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Funnel provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, creed, color, citizenship, religion, national origin, age, sex, familial or marital status, pregnancy, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, or any other legally-protected status in accordance with applicable local, state, and federal laws, regulations, and ordinances.


**Americans with Disabilities Act**


Employee must be able to perform all essential job functions, with or without reasonable accommodation.


**Job Responsibilities**


The above statements reflect the general duties, responsibilities and competencies considered necessary to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the job and should not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements of the position. Funnel may change the specific job duties with or without prior notice based on the needs of the organization.

title: Presales Solutions Architect - AWS
description:
Accepting remote candidates in the following states: Arizona, California, Colorado, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Maryland, Minnesota, Nevada, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, Washington, and Wisconsin.

Requires up to 25% travel.

The TensorIoT Solutions Architect team partners with our customers and AWS to design and build some of the world's most modern cloud architectures and solutions. TensorIoT Solutions Architects collaborate with each other and their respective Sales counterparts to address customer challenges, oftentimes working together to formulate a solution for a given challenge.

A TensorIoT Solutions Architect assists the Customer with bridging the gap between business goals and technology solutions. As the customer’s trusted technical advocate, Solutions Architects not only help organizations small and large understand best practices around advanced machine learning and cloud based solutions, but also provide insight into areas such as migrations, modernizing existing infrastructure or applications, and building new and innovative solutions using cutting edge services.

As a Solutions Architect, you will have the unique opportunity to assist customers in shaping the future of their business. In order to accomplish this, you will be in constant communication with TensorIoT Delivery practice managers and industry and area-of-depth experts to help shape and execute the strategy to realize the customer’s overarching vision.

The TensorIoT Solutions Architect team is committed to ensuring harmony of both work and life. We do this by allowing for autonomy in your day to day activities, focusing more on the solutions and outcomes driven by customer obsession to steer your work day. Since we serve customers all over the world, expect up to 25% travel. While there are TensorIoT offices available in select locations, the Solutions Architecture team works primarily remotely. Work hours are very flexible and typically are driven by your workload.

We’re looking for someone who has:

* 2+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in AWS application or infrastructure
* 4+ years within specific technology domain areas (Gen AI, ML/AI, IoT)
* Technical degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
* 4+ years developing technology solutions in the cloud
* Experience building out CDK scripts, CloudFormation and Terraform templates, and architecting production-grade enterprise-scale applications on AWS.
* Strong familiarity with one of the following languages: Python, Java, Javascript, Nodejs
* At least 1 AWS Professional or Specialty certification
* Willing to do up to 25% travel to customer sites. Will be in front of customers, holding POCs, demos, and working with sales teams.
* 2+ Years customer-facing experience in a pre-sales engineering role
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
* The ability to create and present detailed reports and presentations.
* Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively with different teams and stakeholders.
* Time management and organizational skills to handle multiple projects simultaneously.
* Adaptability and willingness to learn new tools and techniques as needed.

What we offer:

* Competitive salary based on experience
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
* 401k plan with matching
* Unlimited PTO
* Flexible work hours and the ability to work from home

About TensorIoT

TensorIoT is an AWS Advanced Consulting Partner. We help companies realize the value and efficiency of the AWS ecosystem. From building PoCs and MVPs to production-ready applications, we are tackling complex business problems every day and developing solutions to drive customer success.

TensorIoT's founders helped build world-class IoT and AI platforms at AWS and Google, and are now creating solutions to simplify the way enterprises incorporate edge devices and their data into their day to day operations. Our mission is to help connect devices and make them intelligent. Our founders firmly believe in the transformative potential of smarter devices to enhance our quality of life, and we're just getting started!

TensorIoT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. This means that we are committed to diversity and inclusion, and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and make our hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Travel requirement:

* Up to 25% travel

Experience:

* AI: 2 years (Required)
* IoT: 2 years (Required)
* serverless: 2 years (Required)
* Architecting solutions on AWS: 2 years (Required)
* crafting SoW presentations: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* AWS Certification (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Enterprise Cloud Architect
description:
Description:

cloudEQ is seeking a highly skilled Enterprise Cloud Architect with a specialization in advanced AWS services and a strong familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The ideal candidate will have extensive experience leading large-scale migrations to cloud environments and implementing DevOps practices within enterprise settings. We offer a dynamic, high-energy, high-paced, performance-based, team-driven environment, with the support system for success.


If you are passionate about cloud architecture, AWS, GCP, large-scale migrations, and DevOps, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to join our team as an Enterprise Cloud Architect.


Requirements: ***Roles and Responsibilities***

* Develop and implement secure and scalable cloud solutions on AWS and GCP for enterprise clients, aligning the solutions with business objectives and technical requirements.
* Lead the migration of existing workloads to AWS and GCP while advising on optimal cloud placement for new workloads.
* Create blueprints and templates using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like CloudFormation to ensure consistency and repeatability.
* Configure and manage security controls to protect applications and data in the cloud and Utilize automation tools and scripts to automate repetitive tasks and improve efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, DevOps, security) to ensure successful cloud adoption and ongoing support.
* Stay up-to-date on the latest AWS and other cloud advancements and best practices.
* Mentor and guide other cloud architects and engineers within the team, fostering a strong knowledge-sharing culture.
* Experience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), automation (CloudFormation, Terraform), and CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions) on both AWS and GCP is a plus.
* Demonstrate a strong willingness and eagerness to learn and be certified in other cloud providers like GCP and Azure.

***Qualifications***

* Possesses a bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related technical field; a preference for candidates with advanced certifications in AWS, GCP, or equivalent cloud technologies, showcasing specialized skills in cloud infrastructure and services.
* Offers an extensive background (5+ years) in the design and deployment of cloud solutions in enterprise-scale environments, with an expert focus on utilizing AWS and GCP services to create high-performance architectures.
* Demonstrates a verifiable history of leading and executing major cloud migration initiatives, with expertise in ensuring high availability, minimizing downtime, and promoting operational efficiency during and after the transition.
* Has a firm grounding in DevOps and DevSecOps principles, with hands-on experience in integrating these practices into large enterprises. This includes proficiency with CI/CD tools, such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins, AWS CodeCommit, CodeBuild, and CodeDeploy, to automate pipelines and facilitate secure, swift deployments.
* Strong command of communication and leadership abilities, adept at working with cross-functional teams and conveying intricate technical notions to stakeholders with varying degrees of technical knowledge.
* Features advanced problem-solving capabilities and strategic thinking, with the ability to address complex challenges in both business and technical domains, always with an eye toward future innovations and improvements.
* Strong analytical, interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
* Ability to effectively multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Proficient computer and software skills
* Considerable knowledge of computer operations and applications
* Demonstration of planning, coordination, communication, and support to the organization.

**Core Competencies**

* Strong MS Office skills, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Strong organizational skills
* Collaboration tools: Teams, WebEx, and Zoom
* Motivated to be resourceful, innovative, organized, and entrepreneurial.
* Ability to collaborate with internal and external resources, clients, teams, and projects.
* Ability to manage multiple time-sensitive initiatives.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment; detail-oriented, strong multi-tasker.
* Able to proactively own & execute designated tasks independently, with a high level of comfort asking for help when needed.

**Education**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related technical field; a preference for candidates with advanced certifications in AWS, GCP, or equivalent cloud technologies, showcasing specialized skills in cloud infrastructure and services.

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to sit and/or stand for up to 8 hours a day.
* Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up-to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects.
* The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; and visual inspection involving minor defects.

title: Presales Solutions Architect (Virtual - North Central US)
description:
**OPENTEXT**  

OpenText is a global leader in information management, where innovation, creativity, and collaboration are the key components of our corporate culture. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to partner with the most highly regarded companies in the world, tackle complex issues, and contribute to projects that shape the future of digital transformation.

 **The Opportunity:**  

The Business Value Consulting team's mission is to drive increased sales by helping prospects understand the potential value of an investment in OpenText solutions and guide customers towards realization of that value through the most convenient deployment model. The Solution Architect (SA) is a key role to understand customer’s current IT ecosystem and strategy and build a holistic view of the OpenText’ solutions deployment as part of their digital transformation journey.

  

As Solution Architect you will be a senior level professional, part of the Business Value Consulting team inside the Presales community, capable of managing multiple engagements in complex environments collaborating with many different stakeholders.

 **What you are Great at:**

* Supporting corporate efforts to enable the sales teams and providing feedback about new developments in the field of cloud computing & Information Management, and how new trends and best practices can impact our business.
* Collaberating with sales teams along the sales cycle from the discovery and qualification phase to the closing, ensuring internal alignment and becoming a trusted advisor.
* Working with customer’s Enterprise Architects to provide a consensus-based solution that is scalable, adaptable and in synchronization with ever changing business needs.
* Helping customers to align IT strategy and planning with their business goals, driving cloud, security, architecture workshops.
* Managing risk of information and IT assets through appropriate standards and security policies.
* Ensuring proper handover to PS and cloud services, developing migration strategies together.
* Working with customer’s privacy and compliance teams to design solutions that meet their requirements for storing their information assets.

**What it Takes:**

* 5+ years of experience in consultative/complex technical sales and deployment projects, architecture, design, implementation, and/or support of highly distributed applications
* 2+ years of experience in converting on premise workloads to the cloud
* Understanding of cloud computing technologies (SaaS, PaaS, MPC, etc.), business drivers, and emerging computing trends
* Information security (including compliance standards and IT governance)
* Project and program management planning and organizational skills
* Knowledge of the Enterprise Information Management industry and related products – OpenText products preferred

  

OpenText's commitment to diversity and inclusion surpasses legal requirements, evident in our Equal Employment Opportunity Statement of Policy which promotes a respectful and empowering environment for employees of all backgrounds, culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please contact us at hr@opentext.com. Our proactive approach fosters collaboration, innovation, and personal growth, enriching OpenText's vibrant workplace.

title: Solutions Architect (contract-to-hire)
description:
At H&P, our people are our strength.  

At H&P, our people are our strength.  

Since 1920, Helmerich and Payne has been the industry’s most trusted partner in drilling productivity and reliability. As the world changes, so does our approach. We are changing the landscape of drilling by using cutting-edge rig technologies and drilling solutions to build upon a century of success, all while continuing to deliver better outcomes for our customers.  

At H&P, our people are our strength. We strive to continually lead with our Core Values that enable employees to develop on their H&P Journey. We believe that doing the right thing means creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace that empowers our people to bring their authentic selves to work every day.  

Some companies offer career paths. We offer a Journey of a Lifetime. Let's go far, together.
Hear directly from our employees, and leaders about their unique journeys at Helmerich and Payne.
Work Type: Remote
Duration: Contract minimum of 6 months with potential for conversion to full-time hire  

#LI-Remote
This position is expected to be filled in a work location that is within the states of Colorado, Louisiana, Mississippi, Oklahoma, or Texas.
At a Glance:
The IT Architect develops standards, policies, and procedures, designs solutions, and assists in implementing information systems to support the security infrastructure of H&P. The IT Architect coordinates with all areas of the organization to gather business requirements, develop solutions and guide engineering/operations to ensure the systems are working as optimally and securely as possible. The IT Architect will lead analyses of existing systems to ensure evaluate and mitigate risk and safety issues, and ensure the systems effectively meet the needs of the organization.
What You'll Do:  

Lead Design and Review of New Systems:* Well versed in on-premise and cloud network infrastructure architecture
* Understaning of engineering domains such as CCIE w/ Datacentar and Security; Palo Alto ecosystem
* Ability to guide teams on documentation to standards
* Assist with the design and implementation of security and forensics capabilities to ensure governance across multiple public cloud providers.
* Communicate to all levels of the organization, influence behavior and decisions, and advocates for new standards and technology
* Work with H&P and vendor teams to design and support the evolution of infrastructure architecture based on conceptual design and business requirements.
* Collaborate with solution architecture and product development teams to design and implement the infrastructure required to support their vision and strategy.
* Assist in developing the total cost of ownership for solutions.
* Create detailed plans for the integration of new systems architecture into existing infrastructure. This may include logistical plans for the Operations areas to actually conduct the physical integrations, during which the Infrastructure Architect provides technical direction and support


Continuously improve and develop standards, policies, and processes:* Actively engage with internal teams to develop frameworks and tools to drive extensive automation of infrastructure environments and software engineering practices
* Develop and maintain policies, procedures, standards, and associated documentation as necessary.
* Maintain a current knowledge of applicable standards, frameworks, regulations, internal compliance, and related requirements
* Guide H&P and vendor adherence to policies, standards, processes and procedures.
* Develop reference architectures, publish design patterns, drive technical designs to consensus and approval.
* Help formalize, mature, and drive programs related to architecture reviews and remediation.


Operational Support:* Assist in resolving critical issues where a breadth of expertise and/or enterprise perspective is needed.
* Assist in post-problem reviews to validate reasoning and corrective actions.


Vendor Management:* Attend vendor meetings as an H&P subject matter expert.
* Review vendor contracts and statements of work.
* Evaluate and introduce new vendors to H&P to solve specific business needs.


What you need:* Bachelors’ Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Assurance or a related field and 10+ years of hands on experience in IT solution design, or similar role; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Experience with and knowledge of common IT frameworks such as NIST (SP 800-53), NIST Cybersecurity Framework, Sarbanes-Oxley, COBIT, ITIL, etc.
* Understanding of operating systems (Windows and Linux), applications, logging, virtualization technologies; and related server and workstation systems, protocols, and security issues.
* Proven ability to solve problems, thinking creatively, and improve and enhance IT systems design.
* Experience working within small teams and with external (corporate and third-party) groups, preferably within an IT operations environment.
* Highly motivated, self-starting individual able to multi-task and manage to timelines with little supervision in a fast paced environment.
* Proven strong oral and written communication / presentation skills to a broad range of employees. Able to clearly communicate technical details to IT and other technical personnel, but also simplify explanations for non-technical individuals and executives.
* Strong interpersonal skills that establish and sustain close working relationships with functional teams and subject matter experts both internal and external to IT.


This is a contract position providing services to Helmerich & Payne (H&P) through a third-party staffing agency. If you are selected for this role, you will be an employee of the agency and not H&P.

title: Cloud Network Architect
description:
**NOTE- Candidate must be from Tennessee AND US CITIZEN OR GC**

**Summary:**

Looking for a Cloud Network Architecture to work as a part of the Network Engineering team in support of new project deployment and applications migration to cloud.

Candidate should have extensive experience in cloud architecture, network design, and infrastructure deployment.

Ability to take initiative and work independently or with a team with minimal supervision.

Experience with scripting languages and network automation is a plus.

Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent work experience) required.

**Responsibilities:**

Design, implement, and manage cloud architectures, focusing on network and security across AWS, Azure, OCI, and GCP clouds.

Have a comprehensive understanding of network technologies and concepts that includes routing, switching, firewalls, and network monitoring and management.

Design and engineer network solutions utilizing Cisco, Palo Alto, Aviatrix and complex BGP configurations.

Develop, test and upgrade enterprise network architectures for hybrid cloud and multi-cloud environments.

Utilize Infrastructure as code tools, particularly Terraform, to automate and manage infrastructure deployments.

Participate in capacity planning, performance monitoring, and system optimization activities to ensure optimal resource utilization.

Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues related to cloud and network infrastructure, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.

Work with engineers, architects, and IT support teams to establish guides, procedures, documentation using Jira and Confluence tools.

title: Network Security Solutions Architect
description:
**Position: Network Security Solutions Architect III** 

**Location: Remote** 

**Duration: 12 Months** 

**Job Type: Contract** 

**Work Type: Remote** 

**Job Description:**  **J**

**ob Overview** 

* The deployment of the Prisma Access solution requires a great deal of expertise in designing, implementing, troubleshooting, and documenting network security infrastructures and related systems.
* This position servers as the SASE Security Administrator responsible for providing technical analysis, planning, engineering, and implementation in the field of network security.
* The contractor will serve as the expert in enterprise network and cyber security infrastructure, ensuring the efficient and effective implementation of network security solutions.
* The position requires expertise in network and cyber security hardware and software, including routers, firewalls, and Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention devices.
* The candidate will be working with a cross functional team comprised of technical experts from DOI, client, Palo Alto, and other organizations in the transition of the Prisma Access solution from the pilot project to securely connecting all DOI users to the production applications they need.

**Essential Duties and Job Functions** 

* Conduct technical analysis and provide expertise in network security planning, engineering, and administration.
* Serve as the expert in enterprise network and cyber security infrastructure, collaborating with cross-functional teams.
* Analyse implementation techniques and tools to identify the most efficient solutions for network security problems.
* Coordinate third-party maintenance for network and cyber security equipment and troubleshoot problems.
* Validate network security design and assess newly released equipment software and operating systems for vulnerabilities.
* Provide specifications and detailed schematics for unified network architecture.
* Monitor and detect potential performance and throughput issues, developing risk mitigation solutions.
* Provide guidance to team members and report status metrics to the Government officials.
* Provide third-level support and troubleshooting for network problems, including after-hours and weekend support.
* Assist the DOI SOC and cyber defense and response teams during security incidents, involving timely configuration changes to SASE and participation in significant incident bridges.
* Support user access in the client SASE portal based on least privilege roles and provide operations training and support as needed
* Provide guidance, assistance, and recommendations to determine new technical services and solutions for DOI.
* Development of configurations, troubleshooting, and best practices to DOI and stakeholders.
* Expedite and escalate service issues for a quick resolution.
* Manage support cases to ensure issues are recorded, tracked, resolved, and follow-ups are completed promptly.
* Utilize fault isolation and root cause analysis skills to provide DOI and stakeholders with post-sales technical support, configuration, troubleshooting, and standard methodologies.
* Identify product defects and work with client and Manufacturer via lab replication for root cause analysis.
* Work with client and Manufacturer to develop and deliver bug fixes.

**Work Experience** 

* Hands on experience with one or more of the following Next-Gen firewalls: Barracuda, Juniper, Cisco, Check Point, or Palo Alto.
* Extensive experience implementing and maintaining firewalls and staying updated on any released security vulnerabilities and how they affect the network.
* Extensive experience performing on-going optimization of the network security devices to ensure adequate capacity, availability, and scalability.
* Experience designing, implementing, troubleshooting, managing, and documenting network security infrastructures and related systems.
* Demonstrated ability to participate in the Change Management process including creating new change requests, reviewing submitted change forms, peer reviewing submitted change requests, implementing firewall changes and peer reviewing firewall changes.
* Expertise in modifying firewall rule sets, changing policies, whitelisting, content filtering, and troubleshooting issues by studying network traffic flows, locking down applications, and troubleshooting firewalls, routers, and switches.
* In-depth knowledge of layer 4-7 app aware firewalls.
* Experience establishing and modifying site-to-site VPNs.
* Ability to manage threat protection, URL blocking, IOC feeds, routers, and switches.
* Experience performing monthly firewall health checks.
* Experience developing detailed build and test plans for implementing firewalls and other security appliances.

**Job Qualifications** 

* Bachelor’s Degree in information security (or similar field).
* Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Administrator (PCNSA)
* 10+ years of experience in designing and deploying advanced support of enterprise networks and security solution architectures.
* 3+ years of experience in Palo Alto PRISMA Cloud preferred.
* Extensive knowledge of data security practices and systems; NIST, ISO, etc.
* Strong ability to independently debug broad, complex, and unique networks with mixed media and protocols required.
* Ability to interact with customers, vendors, and project managers on a regular basis to support implementations, change management and troubleshooting.
* Experience working in a leading ticketing system and prioritizing workflow based on criticality and urgency.
* Excellent communications and teamwork skills.
* Ability to pass a background investigation.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Work Location: Remote

title: Video Solutions Architect (US)
description:
**About NETINT Technologies Inc.**

  

NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.

  

We are looking for a highly skilled Video Solutions Architect with a unique balance of technical expertise in video processing and encoding and a sales-driven mentality. This role sits at the intersection of technology and sales, driving the entire selling cycle, including hunting for new customer acquisition and expanded business in current accounts for NETINT's disruptive VPU video encoding solutions category. Engineers working closely with end customers in the video streaming and video encoding space interested in expanding professionally in the sales direction are highly encouraged to apply.

 **Responsibilities**

  




* Proactively approach companies with large-scale video operations. Segments include cloud gaming, social network live video streaming, enterprise video conferencing, security and surveillance, and live video platforms. NETINT VPUs offer an 80% reduction in OPEX while improving the quality of live video streams. We need to get the word out!
* Drive the technical and business strategy for managing large accounts, focusing on advanced video processing, and encoding hardware solutions.
* Forge partnerships with customer stakeholders to better understand their business and technical challenges and promote the adoption of NETINT VPUs and solutions.
* Act as a trusted customer advocate, establishing mindshare and promoting broader use of our video solutions while driving communications with the NETINT FAE team, R&D, and sales management.
* Facilitate and organize technical evaluation and review sessions, transferring knowledge to teams considering or already utilizing our solutions.
* Work with customer and NETINT internal teams to develop proof-of-concepts for video applications and showcase the potential of NETINT VPUs and solutions.
* Build strong relationships with senior technical stakeholders within customer organizations, fostering them as video solution advocates.

  


**Qualifications**

  




* Proven track record in software/technology sales or consulting.
* Strong knowledge and experience in video processing, streaming, and encoding hardware solutions are needed.
* Ability to navigate complex customer relationships, understanding their technical and business needs.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, comfortable interacting with stakeholders ranging from developers to CxOs. Must be comfortable making presentations that are business and technical in nature.
* Comfortable traveling as needed (domestic up to 50%), with potential for international trips (up to 10%).

  




NETINT is in an explosive phase of growth, powering some of the world's largest video platforms and services. Our customers encoded over 200 billion minutes of video using our VPUs, and we are just starting. Play a pivotal role in merging the future of video encoding powered by silicon with business, driving growth, and ensuring our clients get the best video solutions!

 ***Acknowledgment and Agreement***

 *NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.*

description:
