Job Description:
Job Summary: The Cloud Solutions Architect is a professional who designs and implements cloud-based communication solutions using Microsoft Teams, Cisco Webex, SIP Solutions, and Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS) Solutions. They work with clients, partners, and internal teams to understand the business requirements, challenges, and goals of the communication scenarios, and provide the best cloud solutions.
Key Responsibilities (Included, but not limited to):* Analyzing and evaluating the current communication infrastructure and processes of the clients and partners, and identifying the gaps and opportunities for improvement.
* Designing and proposing cloud-based communication solutions using Microsoft Teams & Cisco Webex Calling, such as voice, video, chat, conferencing, and collaboration, for a more optimal communication solution.
* Developing and testing the cloud solutions using all available platforms, and ensuring the quality, performance, security, and reliability of the solutions.
* Work with product and sales to ensure an integration of AI into the customer communication platform to help create better digital assets with customer data.
* Providing guidance and support for the adoption and change management of Cloud Voice Solutions
* Staying updated on the latest trends, technologies, and best practices of cloud-based communication solutions around Microsoft Teams and Cisco Webex Calling
* Provide training to Customers & Sales on all communication solutions.
* Produce Statements of Work (SOWs) for calling solutions, detailing the scope, timeline, and budget for contact center implementations.


Qualifications:* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or commensurate experience).
* 3 - 5 years experience in UCaaS and CCaaS solutions.
* Experience in communication and collaboration solutions, preferably with Microsoft Teams, Cisco Webex , or CCaaS Solutions.
* Strong understanding of Microsoft licensing policies.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Teams Calling features and capabilities, such as Operator Connect, Direct Routing, Calling Plan, Audio Conferencing, and Teams Devices
* Knowledge of communication and collaboration technologies and protocols, such as SIP, VoIP, PSTN, SBC, CCaaS, and QoS
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Microsoft Licensing certifications are strongly preferred.

title: Cloud Innovation Architect - Live Production - Virtual
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
Diversified is seeking a skilled and experienced Cloud Innovation Architect for Live Production to help architect, design, and build cloud-based solutions for live broadcast production workflows on cloud platforms. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in architecting and deploying complex solutions, with a focus on live production, channel playout, and content delivery. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience building secure and resilient cloud infrastructure and environments and have a deep understanding of service offerings on different cloud platforms.
  
What will you be doing?
  
* Work as a platform administrator (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) to support the needs of our solutions architects and engineers as they develop solutions.
* Collaborate with our engineering, operations, and product teams to identify requirements for cloud-based solutions that meet the needs of our live broadcast production and post-production workflows.
* Design and architect cloud-based solutions for live broadcast production workflows, channel playout, and content delivery
* Take on the role of subject matter expert on security standards and security best practices such as “least privilege”, NIST 800-53, SOC 2, etc.
* Support the develop and implement scalable, secure, and high-performing solutions on Cloud platforms.
* Work with cross-functional teams to ensure that solutions are optimized for cost, performance, and reliability.
* Maintain, enhance, and own existing cloud-based solutions, improving performance, reliability, and security.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other team members.
* Experience building complex networking infrastructure on premises.


What do we require from you?
  
  

**Education/Certifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, or equivalent work experience
* AWS Solutions Architect Associate or higher certification


**Required/Desired Knowledge, Experience and Skills:**  

* 5-7 years progressive professional experience
* At least 3 years of experience in architecting, designing, and implementing cloud-based solutions. These includes Live Production Platforms, Master Control, Channel Playout, and others.
* Experience with architecting to NIST 800-53, SOC 2, and other security compliance standards.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
* Self-motivated and capable of working in a remote work environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Deep experience with Cloud Formation, Hashi Corp stack, Jira, Lucid Chart and Lucid Spark, GitHub, and other DevOps tools.
* Experience with third-party solutions and services commonly used in the live broadcast media and entertainment industry.
* Cloud certifications such those from GCP, Azure, Oracle, Tata, etc.
* Security certification such as CCSP, CISSP, ect.
* Experience with post-production workflows such as edit in the cloud, storage, and database is a plus.


To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Are you ready to have a blast while making a real impact? Can you see yourself joining a fast paced and innovative tech** **start-up that is partnered with AWS****? If you thrive on helping customers navigate their cloud journey and can communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences, then we have an incredible opportunity for you to make a difference.**


At Local Measure, we are revolutionizing customer experience with our next-generation CCaaS platform, trusted by some of the world's most renowned brands. As a passionate and close-knit team of 50+, we have offices in Sydney, Singapore, Amsterdam, Cape Town, Detroit, and Miami. Our all-star line-up of investors, advisors, and senior executives means you will learn and grow with the best.


We are a values-driven organisation, and our eight Core Values keep us aligned and motivated every day:

* **Zero Ego:** We’re all equal players. Anyone can have an idea and everyone’s opinion gets a shot
* **Think Like A Customer:** We want our customers to thrive. Our #1 commitment is to their success.
* **Own It:** If you have a good idea, run with it. The ball is in your court, ace it.
* **Punch Above:** Our size doesn’t hold us back. We’ll go against anyone and outperform on agility and skill.
* **Have Grit:** We strive to win. We are scrappy, resourceful, and determined.
* **Laugh Out Loud:** Laughter is always heard around our offices. Don’t underestimate the value of a one-liner.
* **Build Each Other Up:** The whole is greater than the sum of its parts. We help each other out and celebrate as a team.
* **Do The Right Thing:** We are responsible for what we put into the world. We play by the rules, even when it’s easier not to.

### **About You**


Are you passionate about guiding customers through the implementation of cutting-edge cloud computing solutions? Are you an AWS whizz looking to further develop your cloud skills and drive thought leadership? Are you skilled at translating complex technical concepts into practical application architectures and integration strategies? If you have a knack for consulting and helping customers achieve success in their contact center transformation, we have an exciting opportunity for you.


Local Measure, a rapidly growing company, is seeking a talented Solutions Architect to join our Americas team. In this role, you will engage directly with customers, leveraging your technical expertise and communication skills to deeply understand their needs, speak their language, and architect sophisticated and Amazon Connect optimized solutions that drive the adoption of our transformative services.


Join our team and be part of an exhilarating journey as we experience remarkable growth and momentum with our clients and partners. This customer-facing position offers a unique opportunity to showcase your technical prowess, contribute to the success of our customers, and play a crucial role in shaping the future of contact center technology.

### **Your Broad Responsibilities Include**

* Owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects. You should be as comfortable discussing complex technical details with a room full of engineers as you are briefing an executive audience. This is a customer facing role!
* Engaging and building relationships with solutions architects from AWS, partner and professional services organizations to drive large and highly complex sales opportunities to closure.
* Supporting our global customer success team to manage technical client questions interfacing between customer support and engineering.
* Leading technical workshops & onsite consultations, and being the bridge between the product teams and partners as it pertains to product updates, roadmap and feedback.
* Capturing and sharing best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS and Partner solutions architect community.
* Authoring or otherwise contributing to Local Measure customer and partner-facing publications such as blogs and whitepapers.
* Help scale the business by automating existing processes and deployments, improving standards/methods/solutions, and growing your own knowledge and sharing it with those around you.
* Leading technical pre-sales engagement from second call through offer acceptance, then leading design workshops up to and including the solution design documentation.
* Designing well-architected solutions for Amazon Connect deployments.


‍

### **Experience**

* Contact Center industry experience and understanding of modern customer experience design.
* 3+ years of customer-facing experience, preferably in the enterprise space.
* 3+ years hands-on experience building, migrating and deploying complex cloud-based solutions.
* Experiencing architecting, implementing and supporting Amazon Web Services infrastructure, topologies and ecosystem.
* Experience building integrations across CRM, Unified Communications and contact center.
* Strong hands-on programming skills with either Python or NodeJS and experience developing solutions with code/scripting and comfortable with AWS Lambda.
* Passion for building contact center solutions and getting hands dirty.
* Strong analytical problem-solving ability.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently or as part of a project team.
* Performance analysis, troubleshooting and remediation techniques.

### **Deep Product Knowledge And Understanding Of Product Features Including**

* Amazon Connect
* Chat and Voice bot solutions (Lex preferred, but Dialog Flow, IBM, Kore, Amelia, etc. okay)
* Development of secure and resilient customer facing APIs
* Serverless Database Technologies (such as DynamoDB) and data pipelines with kinesis and Athena
* API based integrations of Amazon Connect platform with various CRMs for CTI, Screen pop and data feeds
* Any web-based CRMs like Salesforce, Oracle RightNow, Sugar CRM, Microsoft Dynamics, and home-grown solutions
* Contact Center reporting concepts including Amazon Quicksight (or Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.


‍


Previous software development experience in one or more of the following areas (while it isn’t the primary focus, you’ll be writing some code in the role!):

* Backend (Node.js, Python, PHP, Java)
* Web development (JavaScript, HTML/CSS, frontend frameworks - React, Vue.js, Pug, Jade, Angular)
* Experience building with REST APIs
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure) and cloud application architecture.

### **Qualifications**

* B.S. in Computer Science, related fields or commensurate work experience.
* AWS Certification at Associate level or equivalent (preference for Solutions Architect).
* Strong spoken and written English is a must.

 **This position can be remote, but candidates must be based in the USA or Canada and be prepared to serve Americas-based clients during business hours. Applicants for employment must have valid work authorization that does not and/or will not in the future require sponsorship.**

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Copper River Cyber Solutions** is seeking a **Cloud Architect** to join our team in support of a new contract at the Department of Health and Human Services Administration for Strategic Preparedness and Responsiveness. This position will be performed remotely with the occasional need for an onsite meeting in the Washington D.C. area.



The Cloud Architect is responsible for the administration aspects of our client's hybrid cloud system, including creating, managing, fine tuning, and maintaining. Provides analysis and engineering services related to the design, development, and integration and maintenance of hardware, software, man-machine interfaces, and all system level requirements to provide an integrated IT solution. Develops integrated system test requirement, strategies, devices, and systems. May direct system level testing. This involves the establishment of an engineering and/or operational frameworks for new systems ranging from conducting feasibility studies to post-implementation evaluation and maintenance. Systems Engineers also provide top level support for internal systems and software. Working with Project Team Leads and Project Managers to produce high quality products.


**Responsibilities** *(include but are not limited to)***:**


* Serve as the Cloud Architect.
* Work with the Senior Cloud Engineer and the Cloud Engineer.
* Manage client's hybrid cloud environments
* Collaborating with all internal and external partners, such as Government Engineers, Contractor Engineers, Contractor Operations staff, Management, and 3rd party vendors
* Network architecture such as IP Addressing, subnetting, routing, switching, and firewalls
* Provide technical guidance and leadership on the hybrid cloud environments, including Office365, Azure, Azure Stack, AWS, VMWare, Kubernetes, Cloud Management Platforms, and Cloud Access Security Brokers
* Leading Systems Engineers on technical solutions and architecture, particularly regarding hybrid cloud design and developing the target hybrid cloud architecture
* Producing documentation for the hybrid cloud architecture, including network port connectivity, and design choices of the associated applications (Low Level Design, High Level Design)
* Integrate hybrid cloud systems into the enterprise Configuration Management Database
* Automating facets of the hybrid cloud environment, including deployment, SSL certificate monitoring/requests, patching and upgrades in coordination with DevOps Engineers
* Design, Deploy and maintain enterprise class security, network and systems management applications within an Azure and AWS environment.
* Design, both technically compliant and secure Cloud solutions, as well as value-based, on-demand services to facilitate the effective transition and migration of projects and programs into unique and adaptive cloud environment
* Design, implement and maintain all Azure and AWS infrastructure and services within a managed service environment
* Evaluation/design/development/deployment of additional technologies and automation for managed services on Azure and AWS
* Implement process and quality improvements through task automation
* Performing risk analysis of each Engineering Service Request and inform management of the applicable risks
* All aspects of training
* Producing quality documentation
* Working with end-users
* Participate in internal planning and reporting processes
* Work with Project Team Leads
* Ensure standards are followed as directed by Project Team Leads
* Participate in special projects as required


**Requirements:**


* **Clearance:**
+ Ability to obtain a Public Trust clearance
* **Education:**
+ Bachelors degree or prior, relevant experience in lieu of a degree

* **Experience:**
+ Minimum of 10 years' experience
+ AWS experience and knowledge
+ Microsoft Azure experience and knowledge
+ Hybrid cloud experience and knowledge
+ Experience producing quality documentation
+ Experience working with Federal government clients
* **Preferred Skills:**
+ Cloud knowledge and experience
+ Networking knowledge and experience a plus
+ VMWare knowledge and experience a plus
+ Microsoft 365 knowledge and experience a plus
+ Platform and data migration knowledge and experience a plus
+ Cyber Security knowledge and experience a plus

**About Copper River & The Native Village of Eyak:**



Owned by the Native Village of Eyak (NVE), a federally recognized Alaska Native Tribe, the Copper River Family of Companies are a collection of entities that deliver a complementary set of solutions and services to support the diverse missions and requirements of our clients. Proud participants of the Small Business Administration's (SBA) 8(a) Business Development Program since 2006, our companies consist of both current and graduation SBA 8(a) entities. It is our collective purpose to support the Tribe and diversify the NVE's ability to facilitate economic advancement.



The income generated from our companies helps the Native Village of Eyak fund health and social services, economic development, natural resource/environmental education, jobs, job training, and other benefits to the NVE in a manner that is consistent with Alaskan Native cultural values and traditions.


**Copper River's Culture**



The Copper River Family of Companies has a positive, supportive, and thriving culture. At the foundation of our culture is a focus on collaboration. No matter your role or which operating company you work for, we are ONE TEAM working toward the same goals for our customers and for our collective owner- The Native Village of Eyak. How we treat each other is just as important as the work we deliver.


**Benefits**


* Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
* Flexible Spending Account - healthcare and dependent care
* Health Savings Account - high deductible medical plan
* Retirement 401(k) with employer match
* Open leave policy and paid holidays
* Additional benefits including tuition reimbursement, transportation expense account, employee assistance program, and more!


**Note**: These benefits are only applicable to full time, regular associates at Copper River.

  


***Disclaimer:***


*The Copper River Family of Companies provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Lead Program Architect (Cloud Solutions)
description:
Join Our Team! https://www.orusgroup.com/careers/

The Orus Group is hiring a Lead Program Architect for our Cloud Solutions Team in the Metro DC Area in Support of our Federal clients.

**\\*\\*Only applicants local to the Metro Washington, DC Area will be considered\\*\\***

OrusGroup is seeking a Cloud Architect to support our client and third-party vendors with coordinating stakeholders across the project teams; analyzing architectural and engineering challenges that emerge as components are developed by system teams. While working in parallel to synch with SAFe Agile approach and aggressive release schedules.

The Cloud Architect will work with system teams to develop data flow diagrams based on the specific operational context of the system for a given mission area and reviewing of all performance and scalability testing documentation.

Qualifications

* A **US Citizen** and holder of an active security clearance (or be eligible to obtain one)
* **15 years of experience** in DEVSECOPS, Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery, Application Integration/Development experience (ie Java Apps).
* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Knowledge and skills with infrastructure and network engineering; and with systems, infrastructure, network, and cloud engineering.
* Agile Development experience.
* Ability to explain technical concepts, devise strategies, solve problems and describe work efforts.
* AWS Architect Certification and/or MS Azure Certification.
* Experience, and/or certifications in Software/System Development Lifecycle.
* Knowledgeable with Federal Enterprise Architecture (FEAF), or the Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF).
* In-depth experience creating system architecture artifacts, systems and capacity demand models, using Oracle BPM and/or Visio programs.
* Experience developing solutions using Microsoft SharePoint.

Job Overview

* Evaluate vendor deliverables/solution, to identify/mitigate the technical challenges and build cutting-edge solutions to meet the current and future client challenges.
* Perform needs assessments, design, application testing and integration, production cutover, change management, and capacity planning.
* Design enterprise application architectures, including networks, security models, data storage, data flows, high availability, etc.
* Review of performance and scalability testing results and performance and scalability testing documentation for systems
* Modernizing solutions to make use of Cloud services to enhance performance Develop/Perform volume and stress testing to ensure systems and network components are meeting or exceeding the workload requirements.
* Conduct Alternative of Analysis (AoA) on existing systems and third-party tools available in the market. As part of this analysis, develop criteria that provides comparison of systems from system design, cost, schedule and business fit perspective.
* Establishment of Non-Functional Requirements (NFRs) for systems including performance, security, usability, scalability requirements.
* Conduct detailed performance review of mission critical systems and outlined both short-term and long-term recommendations.

Who We Are

The Orus Group prides itself in establishing strong relationships with our clients. We act as trusted advisors to work together with our clients to guide the successful delivery of complex mission critical IT solutions for both government and the private sector. The OrusGroup brings together IT professionals with expertise in IT modernization and cloud migration, risk assurance, and program management.

We put our people first, above all else. The services provided by our team members are built upon decades of experience, refined processes, and evolving technology delivery methodologies. Our team is optimized to bring the ideal mix of real world experience and practical skills. Our goal is to partner with our clients to help them successfully transform and modernize their IT portfolio to align with evolving mandates and mission requirements.

The anticipated salary range for this position is $175,000-$215,000. Salary is based on a range of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills and other job-related qualifications.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**General Description:**  
This position’s purpose is to support The United States Coast Guard’s 671 Enterprise Architecture Division to develop and maintain the Coast Guard’s enterprise architecture. The architect would be responsible for developing and documenting the strategic, capability, business, and data architecture models to include reference architectures and models in the Coast Guard architecture and repository tools.

This mid-level position is a part of a contract support team for the Coast Guard (CG) Enterprise Architecture program. The candidate will be directly responsible for entering architecture elements (e.g., capabilities, application components, etc.) into the CG architecture repository. The candidate will receive and enact guidance from contract team senior architects. The architect will focus capture strategic, capability, and business layers of abstraction while working with Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber and Intelligence (C5I) Service Center (C5ISC) to ensure the establishment of Line of Sight (LoS) of solution architectures to strategic, capability and business layers of architecture.

**Minimum Qualifications:**   
5+ years of demonstrated enterprise architecture experience developing and analyzing architecture models. Experience using the Department of Defense Architecture Framework (DoDAF), Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF), and Unified Architecture Framework (UAF) are desired. BS in system engineering, computer science, industrial engineering, or a related field; or equivalent education and work experience.

**Experience/Skills:**  
Strong team and collaboration skills- Ability to work as a team and take direction from senior architects. Demonstrate ability to deliver under tight timelines. Must be able to demonstrate knowledge of:

* Enterprise Architecture standards, artifacts, and guidelines (Industry and US Government and ISO)
* Collaborating with business and technology stakeholders to understand and translate business challenges into architecture artifacts
* Experience using model-based representations that can be adjusted as required to collect, aggregate, or disaggregate complex and conflicting information about the business
* Federated and Integrated Architecture Descriptions
* The ability to assimilate and correlate disconnected documentation and drawings and articulate their collective relevance to the organization and high-priority issues
* Experience modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques
* Architecture Description Languages (ADL) including SysML and BPMN
* Strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities
* Experience with cloud architecture, microservices, and big data preferred.

**Job Description:** 

* Maintain current architecture products and data in the CG-specific architecture tools (Alfabet and System Architect)
* Capture the strategic enterprise goals and provide traceability through the organization, including mapping to metrics that provide ongoing governance
* Define the data shared across the USCG enterprise and the relationships between those data
* Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities, and operational units
* Establish and maintain solution architecture baselines for the C5I enterprise and maintain traceability to USCG Missions
* Support Enterprise Architecture Board with situational awareness of project impacts on USCG capabilities and strategic outcomes
* Receive and enact guidance received from contract team senior architects
* Perform as a part of an integrated architecture team working remotely with occasional onsite meetings
* Document and develop descriptive architecture representations of strategic, capability, and business architectures, including traceability of data, application, and infrastructure components
* Perform enterprise analysis and evaluations on enterprise architectures
* Conduct architecture assessments
* Develop, document, and maintain reference architectures from USCG doctrine and policy

Federated Enterprise Architecture Certification (FEAC) preferred  
Job Type: Full-time  
Location: Remote with occasional onsite meetings (DC and Portsmouth, VA).  
Must be eligible for US Security Clearance (Secret), which requires US Citizenship.

AS&T is committed to providing a work environment that is free from unlawful discrimination and harassment in any form. AS&T will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship. If you are interested in applying for employment and feel you need a reasonable accommodation pursuant to the ADA, you are encouraged to contact us at admin@adv-sci-tech.com.

AS&T is an EOE/AA Disability/Veteran

title: Consulting Solutions Architect
description:
**THE ROLE: Consulting Solutions Architect.**

**Position: Full time**

**Location: Milwaukee, WI** 

**Travel: 25%**

**Experience: 7+ yrs**

**Job Summary:**

As a Consulting Solutions Architect (CSA) you will play a critical role in the Milwaukee area.

The role of the CSA is to provide a business focused approach and high touch engagement with a select number of high profile accounts.

The CSA evangelizes Presidio product offerings and new vendor technologies within those select customers.

The CSA is primarily responsible for uncovering new opportunities with the customer, quarterbacking multiple concurrent technical initiatives and developing the trusted advisor role with the assigned accounts.

Additionally, the CSA maintains our market beating pre-sales capabilities, drives the expansion of our services business and aligns appropriately with our vendor partners in those assigned clients.

The Consulting Solution Architect is responsible for supporting our clients, our sales teams, our pre-sales teams and our services teams with excellent technical and services knowledge in a highly professional, efficient and always constructive manner.

**Travel Requirements:**

This position involves up to 25% travel in the region. It will be based in the Milwaukee, WI area.

**Job Responsibilities:**

Full understanding of the customer business model, strategy, and objectives

Full understanding of the customer metrics for measuring success, both at the individual and at the corporate level

Be in total agreement with your account manager for strategy in covered account(s)

Establish bi-weekly or monthly account review sessions with AM’s

Gains the trust of assigned accounts through technical relationship building, undoubted integrity, ability to lead and constant professionalism

Be able to message Presidio’s entire portfolio of offerings, our capabilities and position Presidio’s broad solutions set

Drives services and product sales across all areas either through primary knowledge or through the assistance of subject matter experts.

Provide strategic consulting and advice to our primary assigned clients

Be the technical lead on all multi-practice engagements

Provide thought leadership to our clients as they operate and transform their businesses.

Update SFDC with relevant account information and activity

Be involved, on a regular basis, onsite with assigned clients

Engage proactively with assigned accounts, including initiation of strategic meetings

Self motivated

Excellent communication skills & public speaking ability

One or more of the following:

Thorough understanding of Networking Architecture, Cloud Networking, and Network Automation

Thorough understanding of Data Center Software Defined Architecture

Thorough understanding of Collaboration Systems and Architecture

Thorough understanding of Security Frameworks and their applicable use cases

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Al/ML Understanding

Observability

Cloud Hyper-Scaler

**Education and Experience:**

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and/or military experience

7+ years of overall relevant experience including 5+ years of experience in Pre-Sales, Consulting, Enterprise Architecture design OR 5+ years of experience as a technology executive.

title: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking
description:
**THE ROLE: Solutions Architect, Enterprise Networking.**

**Experience: 3 + yrs**

**Location: Grand Rapids, MI, or Lansing, MI**

**Position: Fulltime**

**Job Summary:**

We are looking to add a skilled Enterprise Networking and/or Security focused Solutions Architect to join our team from either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

As a member of the Pre-Sales Engineering Team, you will be responsible for meeting with Presidio’s customers, collecting requirements for business solutions related to network and security projects, and developing engineering solutions for sale to Presidio customers. A successful Solutions Architect (SA) should be able to present and explain various technologies to customers, guide them through requirements gathering, and formulate a solution consisting of hardware, software, licensing, and engineering services.

The ideal candidate will have knowledge and understanding of ENTERPRISE class solutions from leading providers of on-premise and cloud networking/security solutions. Successful candidates will have a solid grasp of network and security design principles based on industry best practices.

**Travel Requirements:**

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 25%. You can be based in either the Grand Rapids, MI or Lansing, MI areas.

**Job Responsibilities:**

Develop high-level technical solutions and present to customers (Hardware, Software, Licensing, Professional Services).

Collect business and technical requirements.

Complete end-to-end, full lifecycle security/network designs.

Drive whiteboard conversations.

Craft customer facing presentations.

Delivering technical presentations and product demonstrations.

Generate hardware configurations (BoM).

Write statements of work (SoW) and develop Professional Service pricing utilizing Presidio tools.

Ability to self-pace and self-set direction in a team environment to drive business.

Work with Account Executive/Extended Sales Teams to develop customer relationship and solutions and assist in overall sales process.

Maintain and develop technical and technology specific skill sets and certifications.

**Required Skills:** 

Expert-level knowledge and experience with design, implementation, and support of two or more of the following:

Complex routing and switching solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Aruba)

Complex wireless solutions (Cisco, Juniper, Aruba)

SDN solutions (Cisco SD-Access, Cisco ACI, VMware NSX, CloudVision)

SDWAN solutions from Cisco, VMware, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Silver Peak, etc.

Cloud security and networking (AWS, Azure, GCP)

Firewalls/VPNs (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

Network Access Control (ISE, FortiNAC, Aruba ClearPass)

IDS/IPS solutions (Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet)

MDR Solutions (Presidio, Arctic Wolf, Rapid7)

Endpoint security (CrowdStrike, SentinelOne, Carbon Black)

Identity and Access Management solutions

Micro-segmentation solutions (Guardicore, Illumio, Cisco Secure Workload)

SASE/SSE (Zscaler, Netskope, Palo Alto)

Security and compliance frameworks such as NIST, PCI, and HIPAA

Load balancing solutions (F5, Netscaler)

Cybersecurity offerings such as vulnerability assessments, penetration tests, compliance, segmentation strategy, or Red Team/Purple Team.

**Additional Desired Skills:**

Technical certifications in the areas of Enterprise Networking, Security, and/or Cloud

Experience with office productivity software and diagramming software such as MS Visio or Lucidchart

Experience in a Value-Added Reseller (VAR) environment

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Description:

LoadSpring is expanding beyond hosting into the world of predictive transformation. At LoadSpring, we bridge innovation and transformation with our LoadSpring Cloud Platform and the integrated data capabilities we provide through LoadSpring INSIGHTS. Our technology solutions provide a secure hosting platform to run the project and capital-intensive industries' most crucial project applications, delivering a reporting and analytical database of clean, accurate, relevant, and structured data.


LoadSpring’s innovative, tenacious, and driven professionals benefit from a unique working environment where our teams blend varying perspectives, experiences, and technologies to solve complex problems. In our value-filled environment, you’ll feel supported with workplace flexibility, commitment to health and wellness, and varied professional growth opportunities. We are excited to invite you to apply for our Cloud Architect position and see how you can help top companies around the globe unlock the power of their data and position them to make the best strategic business decisions!

**About the Cloud Architect position:**


We are seeking a highly skilled Cloud Architect who will be responsible for designing, optimizing, implementing, and maintaining our cloud environment for customers. This includes both front-end (applications), back-end infrastructure, and delivery systems.

**What you'll do as a Cloud Architect:**

*Technology*

* Design, optimize, implement, and troubleshoot the physical and cloud-based infrastructure for LoadSpring’s Cloud.
* Design, optimize, implement, and troubleshoot best practices for hosted applications.
* Work with the SRE team to establish key performance indicators (KPIs) for hosted applications.
* Lead the tech debt remediation efforts to modernize LoadSpring’s technology stack.
* Convert technology requirements of projects into suitable architecture.
* Stay up to date with new technologies and trends in cloud computing.
* Create automation where possible to provide consistency and speed.

*Documentation*

* Create process and documentation for all best practices and ensure best practices are rolled out to existing customers.
* Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills with customers and internal teams.

*Communication*

* Engage with various stakeholders, promoting transparency and effective communication.
* Distill and present complex IT topics to customers and senior leadership, ensuring clarity relevance, and timeliness.

*Mentoring*

* Mentor and train members of other teams in new processes or best practices.
* Helps create a culture to continuously evaluate new or emerging technologies to assist with the creation of the strategic IT Roadmap
* Act as a mentor and technical leader within the infrastructure team, providing guidance, training, and knowledge sharing.


Requirements:
**What you'll need to be a successful Cloud Architect** **:**

* 6+ years of experience in system administration or equivalent type role
* Expert knowledge of Azure Cloud: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Compute, SQL MI, Sentinel, Defender.
* Understanding of infrastructure and application architecture.
* Hands-on with CI/CD tools such as Gitlab
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages like Python, Bash, or PowerShell
* Experience with containerization and container orchestration platforms like AKS.
* Proficiency in Windows and Linux
* Analytical thinking skills.
* Detail oriented.
* Good time management
* Resource coordination and delegation
* Have a passion for creating concrete solutions on the bleeding edge of what is possible.
* Self-motivated leader with sound judgment and a bias toward action.
* Bachelor's degree *preferred*.
* Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert *highly desired.*

**World-Class Benefits**


We are proud of our high-energy and all-around fun working environment. Our team loves to come to work, loves to learn, and loves to win. We offer the following perks to keep you happy, healthy, and engaged at work:

* An entrepreneurial culture where employees are empowered, leadership is open, and your ideas are executed.
* A spot where executives are your partners who encourage innovation and your growth.
* An entire company passionate about our cloud, technology, and top-notch customer service.
* A place where collaboration is highly valuable and all our employees feel like they sit in the office!
* As well as the usual benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability, 401k with a match, and more!

**EEO**  

LoadSpring Solutions Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

  

U.S. Citizenship or Lawful Permanent Residence status may be required for certain positions. For positions requiring U.S. Citizenship or Lawful Permanent Resident status, verification of such status will be required upon accepting employment.

 **Disclaimer**

*Please be aware that fraudulent individuals and organizations may post fake job advertisements using our company's name or logo. We take these matters seriously and are committed to preventing fraudulent activity. To ensure your safety, please always verify the legitimacy of job postings and emails originating solely from the loadspring.com domain, recruiting.paylocity.com domain, or from the email address do-not-reply@mail.paylocity.com. We do not request personal information or payment for job applications, interviews, or employment offers. If you suspect a job posting or email to be fraudulent, please report it to abuse@loadspring.com. Thank you for your vigilance and cooperation.*

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
#### **ABOUT KATMAI**



Katmai is pioneering the future of virtual experiences and hybrid work. The platform brings people together inside an easy-to-navigate 3D environment, enabling natural communication & collaboration, spontaneous interactions, and a sense of place that's been missing from the digital world. The simplicity of the user experience means no headsets are required — Katmai runs in the browser of any webcam-enabled computer.



Katmai was founded in 2020 and is partnering with innovative-focused brands to create everything from branded virtual offices to one-off interactive experiences to digital twins of physical real estate.


#### **JOIN THE TEAM**



The Katmai team spans the globe from Alaska to the Netherlands, with many stops along the way. We are a fully remote team that works inside our own product. Call us biased, but we think it's awesome.



Working at Katmai, we experience first-hand the advantages of being together in the same space. We feel the way it facilitates more natural communication and self-expression. We see it turn strangers into close colleagues and friends. Yes — we are building a virtual game changer, here.



Ready to be part of the future? Join Katmai's innovative team and together, let's redefine virtual experiences and hybrid work in a headset-free world of 3D collaboration and spontaneous interactions!


*We work inside of the Katmai Virtual Office.*

**WHAT WE'RE SEEKING**
----------------------


**Description of Position**



As a Sr. Cloud Software Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud-based solutions. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in cloud architecture, distributed systems, and a passion for building scalable and reliable software applications that will allow us to modernize and consolidate IT infrastructure, automate workloads, and pursue next-generation innovation. To continue this transformation, we're seeking an experienced Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud engineer who has expertise in the strategy, design, development, and implementation of large-scale projects in the cloud.



The ideal candidate will have a firm grasp of emerging technologies, platforms, and applications and an ability to customize them to help our business become more secure and efficient. Extensive knowledge of cloud maintenance, experience in managing staff, and advanced industry knowledge are essential to keep us on the cutting edge. The cloud engineer will have an immediate impact on the day-to-day efficiency of IT operations and an ongoing impact on growth.


**WHAT YOU WILL DO**
--------------------


**Description of Responsibilities**


* Work in tandem with our engineering team to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions for the company; architect and design scalable, reliable, and secure cloud-based solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand application requirements and design cloud infrastructure accordingly.
* Participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle for AWS solutions, including planning, requirements, development, testing, and quality assurance
* Optimize cloud-based applications for scalability and performance.
* Troubleshoot incidents, identify root causes, fix and document problems, and implement preventive measures
* Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with industry standards.
* Demonstrate exceptional problem-solving skills, with an ability to see and solve issues before they affect business productivity
* Define and document best practices and strategies regarding application deployment and infrastructure maintenance

**WHAT YOU BRING**
------------------



Technical Skills


* Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
* Three or more years of experience in architecting, designing, developing, and implementing cloud solutions on AWS platforms
* Proficiency in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Experience in several of the following areas: database architecture, ETL, business intelligence, big data, machine learning, advanced analytics
* Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, Java, or Go.
* Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.
* Experience with microservices architecture and RESTful APIs.
* Understanding of security best practices for cloud environments.
* Knowledge of serverless computing.
* Experience with cloud-based databases and storage solutions.
* Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.


Communication


* You can explain why you like or don't like something.
* You communicate what you can provide and what you need from people.
* You are good at figuring out the underlying problem to solve and work well with other people in this regard.


Leadership


* Collaborate with software engineers, DevOps teams, and other stakeholders to integrate cloud solutions into the overall software development lifecycle.
* People learn something new every time they work with you.
* You help others with specific, constructive feedback to support the growth and development of your peers.


…………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………….



Katmai is a fully remote company currently hiring in the United States and Canada. The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are based on your job-related skills and experience and by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations and refers to the amount Katmai is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Actual base salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to job-related skills, experience, performance, and work location. The salary range listed is just one component of Katmai's total compensation package for employees. These ranges may be modified in the future


* Location is United States: USD $130,000 and USD $170,000 for a Sr. Cloud Engineer
* Location is Canada: C$120,000 and C$150,000 for a Sr. Cloud Engineer


*Katmai is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, current employment status, or caregiver status.*

**Benefits**
------------



Katmai is committed to offering a comprehensive portfolio of employee benefits designed to support the health and wellbeing of you and your family. Benefits vary by location and include:


* 100% remote work environment
* MacBook Pro and monitor
* Health, dental, and vision insurance (100% of premium paid)

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Job Summary**  

We are seeking a skilled Solution Architect to join our team. As a solutions architect on our team, you'll translate your customer’s IT needs and future goals into a plan by crafting architecture products, design specifications, statements of work, requirements, and scripts. Through your leadership, we’ll help transform the way our client uses technology, including cloud migration, integrating advanced technology, and modernizing legacy systems. What do you do next in a career where you’ve reached this level? You mentor the next set of developers to help them grow into tomorrow’s solutions architects. Join us and build the future of technology and protect a critical federal financial agency's mission for the better.  

  

**Requirements**  

* 10+ years of experience with solution architecture, particularly in architecting, designing, and implementing both Enterprise and Cloud based (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS) application implementation
* 10+ years of experience working with business partners to define and understand business needs that help drive system design
* 5 + years of experience with leading system architecture and engineering involving the integration of COTS, GOTS, and FOSS software solutions, cloud, infrastructure, data architecture, and cybersecurity
* Experience with designing cloud-ready, independent applications and systems using open-source products
* Knowledge of Architectural Modeling, Data Modeling, Software Infrastructure, IT standards, Platform Architecture, Technical risk management, IT Strategic Planning, Software Architecture, or IT Policies
* Knowledge of Cloud technologies, including AWS or Azure
* Knowledge of Data Management Analytics Platforms/technologies (e.g., AWS Redshift, Palantir)
* Ability to develop functional and technical architecture diagrams, presentations, analysis of alternatives and documentation.
* Ability to analyze portfolio and domain business needs, research possible solutions, and define solution implementation approach
* Ability to integrate technical and functional considerations into comprehensive software designs and proposal documentation
* Ability to articulate best practices around the EA function with a focus on emerging cloud, data, analytics technologies
* Bachelor’s degree

  

**Nice to Have:**  

* Experience providing architecture-related support to the large federal agencies
* Experience with EA methodologies/frameworks and Industry best practices on architecture development
* Experience architecting cloud-based enterprise solutions
* Experience with cloud-based technologies and processes supporting Enterprise Portfolio systems (e.g., Agency Customer Experience systems, Tax Administration, Case Management, and Internal Operations Systems)
* Knowledge of IT Security compliance specifications (HIPAA, FISMA, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP)
* Knowledge of certification and accreditation processes for enterprise government solutions
* Applicable Industry certifications in Architecture Frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, FEAF)

  

This is a remote position.

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
**Description**  



  

  

The Leidos Health & Civil sector is seeking an Azure Cloud Architect to support a state Medicaid program that will assist in modernizing Medicaid Enterprise System (MES) architecture with a modular System Integration Platform (SIP) and integration services. The ideal candidate must be a strong architect with Azure credentials and Azure DevOps tools experience to implement the development, test, and production systems and processes, energetic and self-motivated, able to guide and mentor technical professionals, and with a value-driven and customer-centric mindset.

### **\\*\\*Telecommuting role, candidate must currently reside in the USA. Initial 6 months includes travel to North Dakota.**

 **Primary Responsibilities:**

* Contribute to technical architecture, implementation, and operational management of Azure cloud platform.
* Collaborate with other cloud architects to deploy consistent architectural framework across all cloud platforms.
* Participate in various technical and architectural discussion both within the team, across organization and clients.
* Designing, building, testing, automating, and supporting the migration of workloads to Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure
* Leading technical discussion and direction in a collaborative team environment, including architecture, estimation, solution planning and use case creation.
* Apply industry best practices and patterns across infrastructure and application components e.g. security, elasticity, performance.
* Documentation of solutions (e.g. architecture, configuration, and setup)
* Support users in resolving issues by troubleshooting, providing workarounds, or escalating to technology management.

  

Required Qualifications:

* Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect certification
* 7+ years’ experience with architecting, executing and supporting an Azure cloud environment.
* Experience designing, configuring, and administering Azure cloud enterprise implementations using compute cloud resources such as Virtual Machines, Scale sets, Azure containers or Kubernetes, and Cloud Services.
* Strong experience with Azure tools such as Azure DevOps, Repos, Pipelines, and Boards.
* Experienced in Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a service (PaaS) and Software as a service (SaaS) Cloud Hosting Architecture /Design patterns to meet scalability, capacity, availability, performance, storage, cost, and application/platform requirements.
* Experience with DevSecOps practices including IaC, CI/CD pipeline, and automated deployment.
* Demonstrated experience in designing, deploying, and maintenance of production applications in Azure cloud.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills

  

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience with MES Modernization projects.
* Experience with vulnerability scanning tools.
* Experience with agile development.
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, or Information Technology
* Experience with cloud implementations of Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) integration products.

**Original Posting Date:**
--------------------------


2024-02-15
While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

**Pay Range:**
--------------


Pay Range $122,200.00 - $220,900.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

title: Azure Solutions Architect
description:
#### **Who We Are:**



The Data Sherpas are a team of highly skilled and motivated engineers dedicated to guiding our clients through every phase of their cloud journey. Our expertise spans the entirety of cloud computing, data management, and application development. Regardless of the challenge, whether it involves cloud, data, or application development, we've tackled it before or possess the necessary skills and knowledge to succeed.


#### **What We Are Looking For:**



We are searching for self-motivated and data-driven Solutions Architects passionate about designing and implementing innovative solutions at scale. Our ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative environment, working alongside a distributed team of like-minded and highly skilled professionals. If you are eager to lead projects, mentor teams, and drive the development of microservices architectures on cloud platforms, particularly Azure, we want you on our team.


#### **What You'll Do:**


* Lead the design and development of microservices architecture, supporting our "Pricing and Promotion" initiative within the Omni Channel department.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, analyze system needs, and architect scalable, secure, and efficient cloud-based solutions.
* Implement and integrate internal and external APIs, ensuring seamless service communication and data exchange.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to development teams, fostering an environment of collaboration and innovation.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, technologies, and cloud computing and microservices architecture best practices.

#### **What You Have:**


* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, with at least 15 years of experience in software development and cloud architecture.
* Proficiency in Java, with experience in Python or Go.
* Expert knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and API management.
* A solid understanding of security principles and cloud technology certifications, such as Azure Solutions Architect, is preferred.
* Familiarity with serverless computing, event-driven architecture, CI/CD practices, and agile methodologies.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills, excellent communication capabilities, and the ability to work well in a fully remote environment.


***Note: At this time, we cannot engage with third-party agencies. Resumes submitted through unapproved agencies will be automatically rejected.***

title: DBA/Architect
description:
vMOX is looking for a skilled Database Administrator (DBA) who will be pivotal in monitoring, enhancing performance, and managing documentation and scalability of the database infrastructure. The role demands a proactive leader in database design and implementation, capable of deploying a mix of on-premise and cloud-based solutions. If you are adept at delivering comprehensive database solutions, possess a knack for problem solving, and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, this position offers an exciting opportunity to be part of a forward-thinking team.

**In this job you will**:

* Consult with the Business Intelligence, Development and IT teams to understand and determine the company’s data storage needs.
* Integrate into the development process, focusing on design, implementation, migration, and deprecation of SQL database elements.
* Oversee and optimize performance of production SQL servers.
* Troubleshoot and improve slow running queries and stored procedures.
* Conduct regular monitoring, identifying network and resource utilization anomalies in SQL servers.
* Develop and maintain database documentation including Entity-Relationship Diagrams (ERDs) and expended properties on all database objects internal and external tools.
* Optimize long transactions and manage database-level configurations for performance.
* Manage database jobs, including SQL jobs and SSMS server configurations.
* Work on Data Architecture and SQL scripting.
* Lead data warehouse design and implementation, leveraging solutions like Redshift or Snowflake.
* Oversee multiple database environments including production, staging, demo, and QA.
* Document all test procedures and system specifications for all database processes and prepare required programs and scripts.

**Qualifications for the role**:

* Minimum of five years’ experience in SQL server administration.
* Minimum three years of experience in Microsoft SQL Server.
* Strong understanding of T-SQL queries.
* Solid grasp of relational database theory and implementations.
* Experience in designing, building, and managing data warehouses.
* Proficiency in warehousing architecture techniques, including MOLAP, ROLAP, ODS, DM, and EDW.
* Ability to analyze a company’s big-picture data needs.
* Clear communication skills.
* Ability to troubleshoot and solve complex technical problems.
* Eagerness to learn and stay updated with emerging technologies.

**Location:**

100% remote in the comfort of your most effective environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

title: Presales Engineer/Solutions Architect
description:
**Who we are**


Incredibuild empowers developers to radically accelerate their work by shortening build times, allowing more iterations and faster product releases. Thousands of customers including world-leading brands trust our platform to streamline and accelerate everything from compilation to release automation, generating great savings of resources and accelerating Time-To-Market for leading brands.


We’ve helped over 200,000 developers at tech giants like Microsoft, Samsung, Nintendo, Amazon, and many others to develop some of the most successful software in many industries such as gaming, financial services, Embedded software, and more.


In the past three years, Incredibuild has been in hyper-growth, expanding globally with no signs of slowing. We have secured multiple rounds of investments to keep expanding our market share.


This is your opportunity to join a category leader and make a difference.


To read more

  

We are seeking a dynamic and self-driven Solution Architect to join our Solution Architecture team. In this role, you will be instrumental in understanding our customers' needs, formulating effective solutions, and ensuring they derive maximum value from our cutting-edge solutions. This is an exciting opportunity to thrive in a challenging, fast-paced environment.

 **﻿What you'll be doing:**

* Lead technical and business discussions, articulating the unique value of Incredibuild.
* Serve as the technical owner throughout the sales cycle, ensuring a seamless experience for our customers.
* Conduct demo calls with prospects and potential partners, showcasing the power and capabilities of Incredibuild solutions.
* Manage end-to-end Proof of Concepts (POCs), including defining KPIs, implementation, execution, support, and delivering impactful results.
* Focus on providing value by deeply understanding customer pains and needs, and presenting tailored business solutions.
* Present Incredibuild solutions to diverse stakeholders, ranging from C-level executives to developers.
* Collaborate with Account Executives and prospects to technically qualify opportunities.

  

Requirements:  

  

**What You'll Need:**

* 3-5 years of experience as a Solution Architect, SE, or Solution Consultant.
* Excellent written, presentation, and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to present technology recommendations from a business perspective.
* Independent and self-driven, with a proven ability to work remotely.
* Proficient infrastructure wizard with expertise in Windows, Linux, network, and IT security in both on-premises and cloud environments.
* Knowledge of SDLC & CI/CD infrastructure, build systems, and ecosystem tools.
* Strong hands-on background with the ability to troubleshoot complex systems.
* Ability to work under pressure, managing multiple opportunities and POCs concurrently.
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and remotely.
* Development experience, especially in C/C++ - **advantage.**

  

Compensation Range: $155,000-$200,000 base salary (+ benefits, including generous 401K, unlimited PTO, generous medical coverage, life insurance, commute expenses, food allowance). In addition to the base salary, this role includes the opportunity to earn performance-based compensation and/or a discretionary bonus, in accordance with the Company's policies. Compensation finally awarded will be commensurate with the candidate’s skills and experience.

title: Cloud Database Administrator
description:
Synergy Business Innovation & Solutions is a premier implementer of cutting-edge software solutions. Synergy brings the experience and expertise necessary to deliver capability that provides tangible ROI to our customers. Synergy’s core areas of expertise are in the fields of Digital Transformation, Cloud Solutions, SaaS and Low-Code/No-Code solutions, Emerging Technologies, Data analytics and Visualization, Information Assurance, and Business Process Re-Engineering.

Synergy offers its employees a generous portfolio of core and voluntary benefits including group medical, dental, and vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k) with immediately vested company match, PTO/Sick Leave, 11 paid federal holidays, company paid life, short-term and long-term disability insurance, tuition and training reimbursement, fitness/wellness reimbursement, a referral bonus program, and life management programs.

At Synergy, you’ll be challenged and given the opportunity to grow in your career path. In fact, growth is such a big deal to us that you will have dedicated career coaches available for every employee, company-funded certification opportunities, education reimbursement, and a general open-door policy so that you have support when you need it. Our team is eager to learn, fast-paced, and quality-driven—if that sounds like you, Synergy has a position for you!

This position is designated as work-from-home. **Description*****:*** Oversees the SQL Database platform and possesses extensive experience and knowledge in:

* Develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell, Azure CLI, or other relevant tools to streamline administrative tasks.
* Implement and enforce security best practices for Azure databases.
* Provision and configure Azure database services, including SQL Database, SQL MI, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, etc.

Advanced proficiency in analytical, project planning, negotiating, interpersonal, and communication skills (written and oral).
