title: Sr. Cloud Architect
description:
Are you looking for a challenging role as a **Sr. Cloud Architect**?


As a leading managed service provider (MSP), InterVision assists IT leaders in solving the most crucial challenges they face by solving for the right technology, deployed on the right premises, and managed through the right model to fit their unique demands and meet their long-term goals.


InterVision’s mission is to transform business through the evolutionary power of technology, and we’re committed to unlocking value by delivering innovative technology through a consultative approach. Our people are the best in their field!


*If you are looking for a career changing opportunity, we want to meet you!*


InterVision Company is seeking a **Cloud Architect,** responsible for architecting, designing, and implementing highly complex cloud architectures including hybrid cloud environments, working as part of a mid-sized, geographically distributed Cloud Services team. The Sr Cloud Architect manages multiple assignments designing and implementing a broad array of AWS services, works with clients to determine their needs, understands their as-is environment, and recommends target AWS architectures while referencing the underlying rationale for architecture decisions that are based on industry standards (e.g. Well-Architected Framework). Lead teams of engineers in the build-out of complex hybrid cloud environments lead large migrations and bring forward ideas on how to use the latest AWS services to optimize environments and reduce technical debt.


**We welcome your experience and talents to our team!**


* 3+ years of professional IT Operations or Infrastructure implementation experience.
* 3+ years’ experience provisioning, operating, and managing AWS environments.
* Must possess the following active certification: AWS Solutions Architect – Associate.
* Thorough understanding of Cloud Computing: virtualization technologies, Infrastructure as a Service, Platform as a Service and Software as a Service Cloud delivery models and the current competitive landscape.
* Extensive experience as Cloud Solutions Architect with AWS IaaS and PaaS (AWS EC2, S3, VPC, RDS, Route53, DirectConnect, VPN, CloudFront, etc.)
* Experience with AWS-managed services Amazon Kinesis, AWS Lambda, Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS), Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS), and Amazon Simple Workflow Service (Amazon SWF).
* Knowledge with Web Services, API Gateways and application integration development and design
* Experience with Linux and Windows
* Knowledge of agile software development practices and release management.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills; Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff.
* Must be a self-starter who requires minimal supervision.
* Meets all team deadlines and responsibilities, listens to others and values opinions, helps team leader meet goals, and promotes a team atmosphere.
* Must have strong organizational skills to handle heavy workload and multiple projects with frequent interruptions and schedule changes.


**Some of the exciting work you will encounter:**


* Design, implement and maintain all AWS infrastructure and services within a managed service environment.
* Design, deploy and maintain enterprise-class security, network and systems management applications within an AWS environment.
* Design and implement availability, scalability, and performance plans for the AWS-managed service environment.
* Continual re-evaluation of existing stack and infrastructure to maintain optimal performance, availability and security.
* Implement process and quality improvements through task automation. Institute infrastructure as code, security automation and automation or routine maintenance tasks.
* Perform data migration from on-premises environments into AWS
* Support the business development lifecycle (Business Development, Capture, Solution Architect, Pricing and Proposal Development)


**How Do We Back Our Strong Reputation?**


**GREAT PLACE TO WORK:** If you thrive in an environment of growth and individual impact, InterVision is the place for you!


**CUSTOMER SUCCESS:**


When it comes to technology, our 30+ year history has guided some of the largest and most influential companies solve their problems with a broad range of innovative technologies ranging from network infrastructure to collaboration to cloud migrations.


InterVision can not only help clients refine their strategy with the right technology and the right cloud strategy, but also bring the resource models to take it to the finish line, assuring them a powerful combination of vision and capabilities.


**BROAD CAPABILITIES:** InterVision offers a wide range of services and solutions that organizations need to thrive in today’s dynamic IT market, including a broad range of innovative solutions for datacenter and cloud transformation, IT resiliency, modern communications, remote workforce and advanced data analytics. We’re competitive at all levels of engagement.


**INDUSTRY ACCOLADES:** InterVision has received some of the technology industry’s most prestigious awards and acknowledgements – repeatedly by Gartner® and Forrester™ plus Inc. Magazine’s 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies.


**TOP VENDOR CERTIFICATIONS:** InterVision holds the highest certifications and partner levels with leading technology vendors, and we have teams of trained, certified engineers supporting their solutions. Here are just a few of the certifications from our list of 80+ vendors: Amazon Partner Network (APN) Premier Consulting Partner (with seven competencies), NetApp Star Partner, Cisco Gold Certification, Cisco Cloud and Managed Services Master, Juniper Elite Partner, Microsoft Gold Partner, AT&T Premier Partner, Palo Alto Networks Diamond Partner, and VMware Premier Partner to name a few.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**Solution Architect**

*(Military Veterans are highly encouraged to apply)*

**Role Overview**

BDR Solutions, LLC is seeking a Solution Architect to join the BDR Growth Team. The Solution Architect will be responsible for leading and designing technical solutions, processes, and staffing mix within the domains of systems engineering, data and business analytics, data science, cyber security, management consulting, healthcare IT, and program management to create and craft high-quality technical solutions for written proposals, white papers, client engagements, and oral presentations. This position will report to the Senior Vice President of Growth. The ideal candidate will have experience serving in leadership roles on Federal IT proposals with prior experience serving as a technical solution architect or technical capture manager.

**Responsibilities**

· Assess technical requirements and objectives and design technical IT and management solutions applying industry best practices, frameworks, and technologies (e.g., DAMA DMBOK, Agile, Cloud, DevSecOps, low-code/no-code platforms, AI/ML, etc.) resulting in tailored solutions for integration into written technical proposal, white papers, client presentations, and oral presentations.

· Apply analytics, problem-solving and communication skills to identify best fit technology solutions aligned to client requirements to deliver winning proposal to federal civilian, federal health, and other federal markets.

· Architect and design innovative and cost-effective technical solutions that meet and exceed customer requirements.

· Design approaches that optimize enterprise architecture across customer needs, business constraints, and technological implementation feasibility

· Provide technical leadership and consulting level support on industry trends and standards on business and technical solutions.

· Provide facilitation for collaborative calls with partners, internal staff, and clients

· Collect and process strategic plans, goals, and objectives for Veterans Affairs (VA), Department of Homeland Security, Department of Defense, and other Federal agencies

· Collaborate with BDR Growth and Operations teams leading technical direction to support the business development lifecycle including pre-sales, capture, and proposal.

· Create technical solutions for proposals and manage technical response development by partnering with contributors from various internal and external teams via virtual and/or in-person meetings

· Research and provide context and feasibility of solutions relative to customer business needs

· Support project start-up by performing technical interviews for resources to deliver work assignments

· Lead technical aspects of the capture lifecycle including pre-proposal planning activities, kick-off meeting, value proposition conveyance, theme development, technical solution feasibility, technical writing, and technical reviews.

· Review/analyze proposal sections for consistency and clarity: Compliance with solicitation requirements, and alignment with proposed solutions and themes.

· Collaboratively work with business development, R&D, and operational leadership to obtain adequate resources for accomplishing high-quality proposal development in a timely manner.

· Ongoing improvements: Assist in the development and refinement of templates and standardized processes to streamline proposal development.

**Required Minimum Qualifications**

* Demonstrate a minimum of 8+ years with experience in solution delivery, implementation, or engineering within DevSecOps, SDLC, Agile, Cloud optimization, and/or emerging technologies/capabilities (e.g., AI/ML, RPA, ZTA, etc.).
* In depth business and technical knowledge of technology trends and standards in government IT and digital services transformation
* Experience leading technical discussions including ability to ake part in persuasive discourse with peers, partners, capture, pricing, and executive leadership
* Proven experience to architect technical solutions based on client requirements
* Ability to manage several proposals, projects, and priorities
* Experience and expertise within the Federal IT market space
* High-level of expertise in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and SharePoint).
* Proven excellent oral and written communication.

**Ideal Experience**

* Proven experience working in high pace environment with a successful track record supporting proposals under VA T4NG, GSA MAS99 54151S, STARS III, and CIO-SP3.
* Dynamic interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of audiences (e.g., Executive management, subcontractors, technical and management staff)
* Demonstrated experience communicating clearly orally and in writing, and producing high quality written products.
* Strong relationships with technology vendors or service providers

In addition, U.S Citizenship is required. Individuals will be subject to a background investigation including, but not limited to criminal history, employment and education verification, drug testing, and creditworthiness.

BDR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or genetic information.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $160,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Solution architecture: 6 years (Required)
* Federal Government: 2 years (Required)
* AWS: 4 years (Required)
* AI/ML: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Solutions Architect HPC
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

This commissioned technical-sales role is focused on the HPC and HPC/AI segment. You will be responsible for advising and influencing customer and partners. You will collaborate with other Intel teams and partners to architect solutions, enabling our targeted end-user customers achieve their technical and business goals. This position will interface with senior technical and business decision makers and drive customer market segment requirements and feedback into the business unit, to influence future products.

  

This individual will need to communicate, present, and influence audiences representing engineering, operations, and executives.  

Daily activities will include providing direct technical assistance and training while collaborating with Intel product groups, sales teams, solution providers, and end customers.


A successful candidate must possess:

* History of server Hardware/sw integration and configuration
* Experience of running typical HPC simulations.
* Willingness to understand and use AI Frameworks and topologies.
* Strong industry network with established technical and business relationships.
* Strong communication skills and willingness to effectively communicate with all management levels of internal and external organizations.
* Track record of working in complex matrixed environment and delivering results through collaboration

**Qualifications**
------------------

  

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. **This position is not eligible for Intel Immigration sponsorship.**

**Minimum Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in STEM, Business or related and 4+ years of experience in architecting HPC and HPC/AI solutions or technical understanding of Processor Architecture, HPC System Architecture, Benchmarking, SW, Analytics and AI.
* Or 5+ years' experience in HPC technical sales, technical sales support, or a technical marketing role supporting sales in lieu of the degree.
**Inside this Business Group**
------------------------------

  

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.  

**Posting Statement**
---------------------

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.  

**Benefits**
------------

  

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.  

  

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in US, Colorado, New York, Washington, California: $181,145.00-$289,863.00  

* Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

**Working Model**
-----------------

  

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. **In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.**

description:

title: Cloud Architect - Remote
description:
**Pharmacy Benefits Reinvented-** As the industry’s alternative pharmacy benefit manager (PBM), we’re committed to making prescriptions more affordable for you and your members. Here at Navitus, our team members work in an environment that celebrates creativity, fosters diversity and encourages growth. We welcome new ideas and share a passion for excellence.


The **Cloud Architect** ensures efforts are in alignment with the Enterprise Architecture team to support customer-focused objectives and the IT Vision, a collaborative partner delivering innovative ideas, solutions, and services to simplify people's lives. The Cloud Architect will create and execute cloud computing strategies. The Cloud Architect is responsible for designing, development and managing cloud infrastructure and assets in support of corporate initiatives in cloud computing and automation, with a focus on the design of systems and services that run on cloud platforms.


The Cloud Architect will be responsible for ensuring that critical applications are designed and optimized for high availability and disaster recovery, while also ensuring alignment with strategic direction and cost optimized solutions.


Is this you? Find out more below!

**How do I make an impact on my team?**

* Architecting, building, and maintaining cost-efficient, scalable cloud environments for the organization
* Provides hands-on technical coaching to accelerate cloud learning across the Cloud foundations team and product teams
* Create a well-informed cloud strategy and manage the adaption process
* Designing, building, maintaining internal cloud applications for the organization utilizing stakeholder feedback
* Transferring data and internal processes to cloud architecture
* Documents complex procedures and complex troubleshooting procedures related to systems/networks software and hardware
* Excellent knowledge of cloud computing technologies and current computing trends
* Analyze current technologies used within the company and determine ways to improve
* Provides mentoring to the team for technical challenges
* Designs and Implements solutions based on Architectural best practices
* Implements re-architecting existing applications on Cloud to AWS
* Keeping cloud environments secure and preventing downtime or security breaches
* Design reference architecture and provide input to the DevOps team for implementation of codified stacks that meet the needs of the applications
* Lead the effort to automate and set up traditional infrastructure components as well as cloud native infrastructure and middleware in both on-premises and public cloud environments heavily utilizing Infrastructure as Code practices
* Oversee and lead disaster recovery planning, testing, and auditing

**What our team expects from you?**

* A four-year college degree required in the field of computer science and/or a minimum of 7+ years of professional experience in application, software, and infrastructure design and implementation
* Experience developing IT and cloud infrastructure
* Experience in software engineering and design architecture
* Healthcare industry practices and HIPAA knowledge preferred
* Knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws
* Participate in, adhere to, and support compliance program objectives
* The ability to consistently interact cooperatively and respectfully with other employees

**What can you expect from Navitus?**

* Hours/Location: Monday – Friday: 8:00am-5:00pm CST, Remote
* Paid Volunteer Hours
* Educational Assistance Plan and Professional Membership assistance
* Referral Bonus Program – up to $750!
* Top of the industry benefits for Health, Dental, and Vision insurance, Flexible Spending Account, Paid Time Off, Eight paid holidays, 401K, Short-term and Long-term disability, College Savings Plan, Paid Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance Program, and Employee Assistance Program

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Tonkean is the world’s first totally customizable process experience platform. With Tonkean, you can create intelligent, personalized automations that integrate with every app or system your organization uses. You can cultivate an employee experience that democratizes access to innovative technologies traditionally only available to highly trained developers. You can enable employees to focus more fully on high-value tasks, because you can enable them to automate low-value tasks. You can create inbox solutions that automatically analyze, prioritize, and route unstructured requests coming from any source, and you can track the status of action items as employees collaborate across teams to complete them. And you can design processes that employees are guaranteed to adopt and benefit from no matter their technical acumen, because Tonkean meets employees where they are—eliminating the need for change management—and is 100% no-code.  

At Tonkean, we believe that all this—compliance, efficiency, operational excellence—requires high levels of process adoption. But to ensure high levels of process adoption, you need to create processes that provide a great employee experience: that serve employees’ needs, understand their preferences, and solve their problems.  

To that end, you need a barrier-breaking technology partner. That’s what Tonkean seeks to be. **ROLE OVERVIEW**
Our Solutions Architects are instrumental in bringing our clients' business processes to life in our platform. As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for discovering and extracting the existing business processes in a company, finding the ideal path forward for how the process should function in a people-first fashion, and actually turning on these magical Tonkean modules live in production environments. **If this opportunity excites you, we'd love to talk.**
### **WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON**

* Understand the strategic, tactical, and technical components of a business process, agnostic to the vertical (sales, support, IT, finance, etc.) and be able to find efficiency gains via Tonkean's business process philosophy
* Build custom demos for prospects based on their unique business needs to remove technical objections in the sales cycle
* Present custom technical demos to Directors, VPs, and Executives at Fortune 1000 companies
* Establish a trusted relationship with existing customers to drive continued value of our platform
* Act as a Tonkean Subject Matter Expert, providing guidance and technical support for our customers
* Work closely with engineering and R&D to continue to expand the breadth of the Tonkean platform
* Document technical knowledge in the form of knowledge base articles, tutorial videos

### **ABOUT YOU**

* Proven work experience as a Solutions Architect, Sales Engineer, Sales Consultant or similar role
* Operations experience, or hands-on experience designing/re-designing and implementing business processes a major bonus
* Hands-on experience with Web applications, REST APIs, Data integrations, or Webhooks
* Good understanding of SaaS, Cloud and common software environments
* Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills (being able to take technically complicated concepts and explaining them in layman terms)
* Ability to provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal
* Experience in legal tech or procurement tech is a PLUS
* BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or relevant field

### **OUR VALUES**

* **There Is Always A Way.** At Tonkean, we believe that nothing is impossible. There is a solution to every problem - you just need to find it.
* **Think People First.** We believe in investing in, empowering, and prioritizing people. We work as a team and win as a team. We listen with purpose as we speak with courage. We believe in diversity. We always ask ourselves: Is this giving value to our customers? Is this improving our team? Is this helping me be better?
* **Start With Why And Fail Fast.** We believe that progress is the only way forward; that action is always better than no action; that innovation requires bravery. We believe that every worthwhile “how” starts with an important “why.” If you know the “why”, and you can learn from it, It’s never a failure. It is the operational cost of progress.
* **No BS.** To matter, you must - stay focused, keep it simple and always move the needle. We don’t have time for BS. We don’t waste energy; we prioritize efficiency; we stay focused; and we always try to optimize for what’s important.

### **PERKS AND BENEFITS**

* Join a fast-growing business that is venture-backed by Lightspeed Venture Partners and Foundation Capital.
* Collaborate with a talented yet humble team as we empower operations teams and eliminate mundane tasks.
* Competitive compensation & equity package
* Virtual social events, and annual company retreats
* 401k, Medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Tonkean provides each employee with a MacBook and a one-time work from home setup stipend (reimbursable) of $1000(USD) upon commencing employment.


Tonkean welcomes everyone. We believe every member of our team enriches our diversity and inclusion by broadening our ways of problem-solving for future challenges. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications for this job, we strongly encourage you to apply.  

Tonkean is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program. We believe diversity is important to building a successful business and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, reproductive health decisions or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Solutions Architect (Python, SQL, AWS)
description:
**Solutions Architect**

 **About BriteCore**



BriteCore is a leading cloud-native core insurance software platform for Property & Casualty Insurers. Our software unlocks business growth, delivers greater productivity, and provides an intuitive customer experience to a large and rapidly modernizing industry. With the BriteCore Software Platform, insurers easily administer policies, manage billing and claims, rapidly configure new products, and access detailed reporting and analytics in an all-in-one core system, including agent and policyholder portals.

  

Trusted by over 90 insurers across North America, BriteCore’s award-winning policy administration solution enables midsize Carriers and MGAs to efficiently manage their insurance operations and effectively compete with the largest insurers. We love great technology and insurance and it shows in every aspect of our solution.

  

This is a **fully remote based** role, however candidates **must be located** in the **US**, with a preferred location of eastern or central time zones.

 **Summary**



The Solutions Architect is a knowledgeable Python, SQL, and Cloud backend programmer who is responsible for helping BriteCore’s Insurance Policy Administration customers address their most complex challenges. If you are a seasoned enterprise software architect, have a strong development background, are self-motivated, and enjoy delighting customers, then BriteCore is the place for you to excel in your career.

 **What you’ll do**


* Design and implement highly scalable and reliable B2B enterprise integrations
* Work with customers and Product Management to design enhancements, write epics/stories, and then code those enhancements
* Design and implement reporting solutions in a regulated environment
* Provide enterprise ISV level support to large-scale customers
* Develop a deep knowledge base in Mutual P&C Insurance best practices and work processes
* Host regular meetings with the executive engineering teams at our largest customers
* Provide Enterprise ISV (Independent Software Vendor) Level Support to BriteCore Customers building their own customizations to the platform
* Work with the customer’s development leaders to re-architect and optimize our Python monolith to support customer innovations and explosive growth to ensure performance, stability and expandability
* Optimize, automate, and support our legacy monthly data delivery and reporting solution, and replace the Python/Panda based technology with SQL and Quicksite datasets and analytics
* Work with DevOps to define appropriate DataDog monitoring to ensure 99.99% uptime and forecast needed horizontal and vertical scaling and coding optimizations needed to ensure that our fast growing customers continue to receive the performance and stability needed to run their business.
* Work with the customer’s technical teams to leverage this DataDog error, performance and RUM monitoring to quickly identify and resolve critical coding and configuration issues

  


**What you’ll bring**


* Computer Science, technical degree, or equivalent practical experience with a solid understanding of programming concepts
* 7+ years experience coding in Python in an enterprise SaaS environment
* 3+ years of experience with leading a 5+ member software engineering team
* Well versed and comfortable with a linux operating environment, including application debugging, monitoring, and maintenance
* Expert level knowledge of:
	+ MySQL or other SQL Database
	+ Database and query optimization
	+ Application Performance Tuning
	+ Cloud Application Design and Delivery
* AWS Technologies
	+ EC2, ECS and Lambda & API Gateway
	+ Amazon S3 - Files and Vendor integrations
	+ CloudWatch - writing queries
	+ Step Functions
* 3+ years of experience with B2B integrations at scale
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Desire to learn continuously and operate in a fast-paced environment

  


**Bonus points**


* 3+ years of experience working with RIA Technologies and Patterns, such as VUE, jQuery, react.js and Knockout JS
* Familiar with Jinja code, code templates
* Experience with using DataDog to tune applications and identify issues
* Experience working in the insurance space is highly desirable

  


**Life at BriteCore**



We take pride in our dynamic, diverse team, unified by shared values of community, integrity, grit and impact. We love what we do and the people we do it with, which is why we welcome every individual, provide them with equal opportunity irrespective of their race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran, disability or any other legally protected rights that one has.

  

We offer great benefits including: medical, dental, vision, 401K (with company match), disability coverage, unlimited PTO, fully paid parental leave and more.

title: Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 13 **Job Title:** Cloud Solutions Architect **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active DoD - CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS **Salary Range:** $128,209 - $192,313**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
Working with an enterprise network architecture and engineering team supporting our Federal customer, the Cloud Architect interfaces with customers to determine technical requirements, feasibility and expectations and strategizes with the client to develop solutions based on a variety of criteria including a clear description of services, functionality, scalability, future proofing, and cost. The Cloud Architect is responsible for designing cloud-based solutions using cloud computing architectural procedures that typically consists of a front-end platform, back end platforms, cloud-based delivery, and a network. Responsible for the support of the development of the Technical Requirements Document and a Detailed Design Document (DDD) for the Cloud Connectivity Architecture, consistent with the associated Functional Requirements Document and DDD, before transitioning to Operations. Responsibility includes designing and communicating compelling solutions that urge prospects to take the desired action and implementing cloud computing architecture solutions that address cloud security and compliance fundamentals, deployment automation and elastic sizing of environments, and multi-tenant implications. Additionally, the Cloud Architect will manage the implementation of the cloud to ensure a successful deployment. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Build Secure Cloud Interconnect (SCI), Netbond, Direct Connect and VPN connections.
Lead Migration from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking.
Provide expert guidance in one or more Cloud Infrastructure (IaaS) offerings and be comfortable discussing solutions with clients.
Design and implement multi-tier architecture solution that is highly available and fault tolerant using Cloud platform services.
Design and implement effective cloud computing solutions that take into account an organization’s structure, communications, and operational business processes, including financial management and cost model implications.
 Manage the process of migrating and transition to a cloud environment.
 Analyze current workloads, migrate existing IT systems to the cloud, an configure new systems or services to enhance business operations. **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance - Must be a U.S. Citizen.
 Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st priority
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret or Secret - 2nd choice
DoD Secret or Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd choice (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated) **Education, Background, and Years of Experience**
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline.
At least 4 years of hands-on experience in Network Design, Network Engineering, Network Operational Support and Cloud engineering experience of Medium to Large enterprise network environments. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Programming and scripting experience in programming languages like C#, Python, Java, or JavaScript
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Public and Private Cloud
Experience with Azure Cloud
Experience with Google Cloud
Experience with Cloud Service Routers (CSRv)
Experience performing requirements gathering with a prospective customer and tailoring a custom product and solution.
Experience with Cloud Identity and Access Management
Experience migrating from legacy on-prem networking to the Cloud Networking
Thorough understanding of Cloud Computing: virtualization technologies, Infrastructure as a Service, Platform as a Service and Software as a Service Cloud delivery models and the current competitive landscape
Thorough understanding of infrastructure (firewalls, load balancers, hypervisor, storage, monitoring, security, etc.) and have experience with orchestration to develop a cloud solution.
A data-driven critical thinking mind, analytical expertise, and a solution-driven, service-oriented personality.
 A knack for working in a similar fast-paced, high-SLA, deadline driven environment.
 Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. **Preferred Skills**
Desired Certifications: AWS - Networking and/or Security Specialty, Solutions Architect Associate or Professional **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
 Fully remote candidates need to be within 4 hours driving distance from NCR. **Strength Demands**
Medium – 50 lbs. Maximum lifting with frequent lift/carry up to 25 lbs. **Physical Requirements**
 Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).
*Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes “The 6 H’s” – Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle.*  

***Happy****: We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment.****Helpful****: We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver.****Honest****: We conduct our business with integrity.****Humble****: We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us.****Hungry****: We desire to consistently improve.****Hustle****: We work hard and get after it.* *These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us* *here.* ***COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements****Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.* **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities**
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Cloud Solutions Engineer
company: T and T Consulting Services Inc
description:
**Project Overview**

  

The T&T Cloud Solutions Engineer (CSE) has responsibility as a T&T corporate resource to **develop, engineer, and implement cloud technology solutions** that align with both client and corporate enterprise architecture needs. The T&T CSE’s solutions will align to and comply with standards, processes, procedures, and targets in **context of Federal and Department of Defense client statutes/regulations**, as well as T&T corporate policy. The T&T CSE will work in concert with the T&T Chief Architect and Senior Application Solutions Engineer. Collectively, this team will be charged with client requirements determination, architecture designs, and encompassing cloud solutions for a customer base that includes DoD, HHS, NIH, VA, DoC, NOAA, NIST, DoJ, Treasury, etc.

  

The T&T CSE will **support multiple project efforts** and corporate initiatives to define/implement/refine cloud “as a Service” (aaS) specifications and solutions to meet enterprise needs for scalability, security, and diverse aaS implementations (e.g., IaaS, SaaS, PaaS, etc.). In coordination with client and T&T corporate stakeholders, the T&T CSE will develop and recommend enterprise performance criteria involving cloud parameters and constructs. Upon approval of such criteria, the T&T CSE will meet/exceed enterprise performance criteria by establishing and implementing leading edge cloud solutions and/or minimum value products that can scale to enterprise level solutions.

  

The T&T ESE is responsible for **analyzing, adopting, adapting, and applying current trends in technology solutions from Cloud Service Providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.).** The CSE will recommend and ultimately implement optimal solutions that readily integrate into a variety of architectural environments/designs and multiple levels of security for both Federal and DoD clientele. The T&T CSE will **establish and build the technological groundwork as basis for their adoption, adaptation, and integration of practical CSP-based solutions to meet/exceed performance criteria.** The T&T CSE candidate must have **hands-on experience** in proactively and holistically guiding clients through transformation and optimization efforts with one or more CSPs. The T&T CSE will articulate solutions, from planning stages to execution, to a wide audience ranging from non-technical to highly technical in oral and digital venues.

  

This position will be located in Falls Church, VA. Remote work, both full and part time, is negotiable. Qualified candidate must have or can attain a Secret clearance.

 **Primary Responsibilities**

  

* Use hands-on experience to proactively and holistically guide, engineer, and implement transformative solutions for enterprise cloud-based architectures
* Assist in solving complex business problems by applying sound cloud engineering principles
* Translate intricate customer requirements and designs into practical cloud solutions
* Define/specify system solutions based on user/client needs, cost, and required integration with existing or projected applications, systems, or platforms
* Provide on-site cloud technical assistance to resolve issues at corporate and client locations
* Refine designs; develop/build cloud solutions to integrate seamlessly into enterprise systems
* Enable faster and smarter business processes; implement analytics for meaningful results
* Engage with senior managers regularly, reporting on project status, activities, and achievements; create reports and documentation for findings and solutions
* Provide solutioning content for use in white papers, proposals, and oral presentations
* Conduct high-level root-cause analysis for service interruption; establish preventive measures
* Design, develop and engineer technical solutions to facilitate new device platform implementations, device roll outs, system updates, and version migrations
* Leverage role/knowledge as corporate subject matter expert in key areas: Azure (MS 365), Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Virtualization, enterprise security, etc.
* Build, scale, secure, migrate, and implement cloud services, especially CI/CD pipelines and aaS solutions, using industry tools

 **Required Skills & Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of hands-on experience in related fields
* Able to attain a Secret clearance
* Deep understanding and working experience in migrating legacy and modern software/systems from “on-premise to hybrid or 100% cloud-based” and “hybrid to 100% cloud-based”
* Minimum of one cloud certification in related fields, examples:
	+ Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate
	+ Google Certified Professional Data Engineer
	+ AWS Certified SysOps Administrator
	+ AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
	+ AWS Certified Developer - Associate
	+ CompTIA Cloud+
	+ Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)
* Minimum of one information systems certification in related fields (e.g., Security+, CCNA, CISSP, etc.)
* Demonstrated experience working in or for DoD, HHS, NIH, VA, DoC, NOAA, NIST, DoJ, Treasury, or equivalent national government organizations
* Excellent solution implementation expertise in IT and Cloud Infrastructure and application modernization and migration techniques.
* Broad IT industry knowledge, expertise in one or more technical areas: User experience, digital transformation, microservices, enterprise service bus, database design, access and identity management, high availability infrastructure, Cloud, IoT, Event Driven Architecture, Service Oriented Architecture, CI/CD, DevSecOps, etc.
* Exemplary oral, written, interpersonal communication and customer service skills.
* Able to produce results within a collaborative environment; proficient in MS Office products
* Highly organized and deadline-driven; able to multitask

**Desired Skills & Qualifications:**

* 10+ years of hands-on experience in related fields
* Active Secret clearance
* Multiple information systems certifications in related fields
* Multiple cloud service provider certifications in related fields

 **Benefits:** Competitive benefits package including: health, dental, vision, life insurance coverage, 401(k) Plan, Training Programs, Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) and Paid Holidays.

***Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled***

title: Data Architect
description:
```Duties```  
As a Data Warehouse Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing data warehouse solutions. Your main duties will include:

- Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into effective data warehouse designs.  
- Designing and developing data models, schemas, and ETL processes to support data integration and transformation.  
- Implementing best practices for data warehouse architecture, including data governance, security, and performance optimization.  
- Working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of data warehouse solutions with other systems.  
- Monitoring and troubleshooting data warehouse performance issues and implementing necessary optimizations.  
- Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can drive business decision-making.  
- Staying up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data warehousing technologies.

```Skills```  
To excel in this role, you should possess the following skills:

- Strong knowledge of data warehousing concepts, methodologies, and best practices.  
- Proficiency in designing and implementing data models, schemas, and ETL processes.  
- Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or NoSQL databases.  
- Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure for building scalable and reliable data warehouse solutions.  
- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python for data manipulation and analysis.  
- Strong understanding of server infrastructure and database design principles.  
- Expertise in SQL for querying and manipulating large datasets.  
- Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot complex issues related to data warehousing.  
- Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

If you are a highly skilled Data Warehouse Architect with a passion for designing robust and scalable solutions, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our dynamic team!

title: Azure Infrastructure Cloud Architect
description:
Tantus Technologies, Inc. (Tantus) - recognized by the Washington Post as a Top Workplace - is seeking a Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Cloud Architect. You will have a hands-on leadership and implementation role in architecting, configuring, implementing, and/or migrating IT systems, services, and applications from an on-premises environment to Azure cloud environments, including Azure Government Community Cloud and Azure Gov Cloud (moderate).

You will also be responsible for supporting the development and maturation of Azure Gov Cloud tenants, subscriptions, landing zones, networking, security, and infrastructure through implementation of Microsoft Azure best practices and infrastructure as code (IaC). The ideal candidate will bring a blend of subject matter expertise, effective leadership capabilities, hands-on Azure and IaC technical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills.

\\*Must be a US Citizen and able to obtain a Public Trust. \\*

\\*\\*Remote role, but ideally prefer a DC Metro area candidate that can join the team and customer in-person 1 day per week but open to fully remote candidates. \\*\\*

**What You'll Do**

* Work with Office of the CIO (OCIO) groups to architect and design Azure environments, infrastructure, and services that enable migration of IT infrastructure, services, applications, and systems from an on-prem environment to Azure.
* Develop and implement scalable and resilient cloud architecture solutions within an Azure Gov Cloud environment.
* Develop and implement migration strategies for Microsoft Office business tools and solutions from local on premises hosted environment to Azure cloud tenants.
* Architect and administer Microsoft Entra ID.
* Create and implement a migration plan for each infrastructure service, system, and/or application that will be transitioned to Azure.
* Create architecture and data flow diagrams for hybrid cloud environments.
* Design and deploy infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, and PowerShell.
* Ensure systems, applications, and data are high availability, backed up, and/or replicated to meet organizational requirements for disaster and business recovery.
* Analyze and ensure that proper monitoring and alerting systems are in place for systems, services, and applications.
* Evaluate and recommend Azure services based on business requirements and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with software developers, system administrators, and other stakeholders to integrate Azure solutions into existing systems and applications.
* Ensure seamless interoperability between on-premises and cloud environments.
* Implement and enforce Federal security requirements to protect Azure-based systems and data.
* Create comprehensive documentation for cloud architecture, configurations, and processes.
* Stay abreast of Azure security updates and industry trends to proactively address potential vulnerabilities.
* Monitor and optimize the performance of Azure resources, identifying and addressing bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
* Implement best practices for resource utilization, cost management, and scalability.
* Collaborate with support teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents promptly.

**Required Knowledge and Skills**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* 7+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure, primarily as an Azure solution engineer.
* 5+ years of experience with Infrastructure-Based Processes: Monitoring, Capacity Planning, Facilities Management, Performance Tuning, Asset Management, Disaster Recovery, Data Center support, Server Virtualization
* Hands-on experience with Azure services such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure Networking, Azure Active Directory, etc.
* Proven experience in migrating, designing, and implementing cloud solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform for Federal government clients.
* Strong knowledge of cloud architecture patterns, best practices, and industry standards.
* Expertise in scripting and using automation tools like PowerShell, Azure CLI, and Terraform.

**Abilities**

* Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively across a broad range of technical and non-technical personnel.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**Nice to Haves**

* Certification in Microsoft Azure (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect Expert) is highly desirable.

**Why Tantus? We Provide:**

* Competitive total compensation package based on the work you do and the contributions you make
* An environment that supports balancing great work with a great life
* A learning organization that invests in you with $3000 annually for professional development opportunities
* Excellent healthcare programs available through United Healthcare
* Community engagement events where you will have ample opportunities to give back by volunteering
* Discretionary quarterly bonuses for above and beyond contributions and outstanding performance

**About Us**

Tantus is an IT development and management consulting firm helping federal programs become more successful, cost-effective and mission-focused through program management oversight and system development and implementation. Our people are committed to making our world better by delivering solutions to improve the effectiveness of government services and citizen experience. Tantus is Latin for “so great” or “so much” – we strive to put great things into everything we do.

Tantus is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, military status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, and require an accommodation to navigate Tantus’ careers website or apply for one of Tantus’ job openings, please contact Human Resources at Hr@tantustech.com to request a reasonable accommodation.

Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal

title: Solutions Architect Lead
description:
Cloud and Things is a leading provider of IT solutions in the public sector. We are dedicated to delivering results and solving complex challenges for our clients. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about making a difference in the world, who are driven by a sense of purpose, and who are committed to excellence. Our team thrives on collaboration, innovation, and delivering high-quality projects that have a significant impact on the public sector's IT landscape. The HR System Modernization Program includes multiple, highly customized PeopleSoft systems. The Solutions Architect Lead will develop technical strategies to enhance these systems while maximizing PeopleSoft capabilities, limiting customizations, and increasing interoperability. The ideal candidate has PeopleSoft experience and proven ability to identify technical options and implementation strategies for requirements not efficiently delivered by PeopleSoft configurations.

**Job Title: Solution Architect Lead**

**Job Duties:**

The Solutions Architect Lead will:

* Participate in finalizing business requirements to develop a firm understanding of needs
* Participate in finalizing functional and technical requirements
* Document legacy system architecture as needed
* Develop strategies to enhance the interoperability of the existing PeopleSoft systems to increase data reliability, streamline workflows, and eliminate duplicate data entry Develop technical solutions to deliver existing and new functionality while reducing the number and complexity of PeopleSoft customizations
* Develop technical solutions to meet business needs not effectively and efficiently delivered by PeopleSoft
* Participate in prototype and proof of concept exercises
* Identify opportunities to streamline the number and complexity of interfaces to PeopleSoft and other applications
* Document the to-be architecture taking into consideration State shared services, enterprise standards and security requirements
* Participate in the development of project, workstream, and sprint planning to sequence the delivery of system enhancements and new functionality to business owners Develop artifacts required to support Software Development Lifecycle standards
* Develop analyses and other products to support Program governance and project management effort

**Deliverables:**

* SDLC artifacts developed to industry and State standards
* Reports and presentations on technical analyses and recommendations
* Reports and presentations on Prototype and Proof of Concept exercises

*Cloud and Things complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.*

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**About DuploCloud:**

DuploCloud is a software platform that allows engineering teams to achieve their infrastructure automation, security and compliance goals by offering DevOps-as-a-Service. We strive to make DevOps and Infrastructure-as-Code accessible for everyone; where application developers can focus on building applications rather than writing thousands of lines of code to automate well known operational workflows and compliance standards. DuploCloud is a venture backed company, Series-B funded by Mayfield Fund, WestBridge Capital and StepStone Group.

**About the Role**



DuploCloud is looking for a Solutions Architect with a demonstrated background in cloud technologies, and driving customer success through solution architecture. The role involves working closely with the Sales organization and engaging in the pre-sales process to enable successful deal conversion. Further, engaging directly with customers to build POCs demonstrates the value of the product. Performing detailed infrastructure assessments of customers' existing environments, producing cost calculators, business RIO plans, and migration project plans This role would also involve working closely with the DevOps team for successful hand off for project implementation.


### **Job Details**


#### **About you**


* 5+ years of demonstrated ability to work as a solutions and/or cloud architect
* Experience working with both customers and internal teams in a pre-sales, consulting, or delivery capacity
* Dynamic team member who will both teach and learn from all of us on the Solutions Engineering team
* Problem solver who can interpret sophisticated problem statements, boil them down into simple solutions, and collaborate with prospects, channel partners
* Comfortable in both a business and technical context, working with executives or talking shop with technical audiences
* Open to giving and receiving feedback, tolerate failure and are passionate about making clients successful
* Strong knowledge of public cloud platforms (AWS. Azure, GCP)
* Strong knowledge of Kubernetes, ECS and similar container orchestration technologies.
* Strong knowledge of Terraform and similar IaC technologies.
* Good knowledge on CI/CD systems
* Enjoy helping customers with their infrastructure transformation via solutions engineering through a 2-3 month DuploCloud onboarding process.

#### **Life at DuploCloud**


* We have an engineering, product driven culture that does right by both our customers and employees.
* Our customers love us, and we're growing quickly.
* Our team has been remote from day one.
* We work hard and set our own schedule/hours.

#### **Location**


* Remote
* San Jose, California

#### **Compensation**



Includes competitive base salary, company performance bonus, stock options and a comprehensive health and benefits package.

**Benefits:**


* Remote flexible work options
* Employee assistance program (EAP)
* Medical, dental & vision benefits supplement
* Life & supplement life and Critical illness insurance
* Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Savings Account (FSA)


**Note:** DuploCloud Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. *If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at careers@duplocloud.net.*


*Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment-qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.*


*This role has been categorized as a Remote position. "Remote" employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.*


*The pay listed above is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Maryland, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, and Washington. The standard base pay range listed for this role may not be applicable to other locations.*


*Applicants may be required to sign a confidentiality agreement during the interview process. Applicants who receive job offers from DuploCloud Inc. will be asked to sign a confidentiality agreement, intellectual property disclosure, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at DuploCloud Inc. and wish to review a copy of the required documents prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.*

title: Solutions Architect - Cloud Identity Security
description:
BeyondTrust is a place where you can bring your purpose to life through the work that you do, creating a safer world through our cyber security SaaS portfolio.



Our culture of flexibility, trust, and continual learning means you will be recognized for your growth, and for the impact you make on our success. You will be surrounded by people who challenge, support, and inspire you to be the best version of yourself.

  

The Role:



BeyondTrust fights daily to secure identities, intelligently surface, and remediate threats, and deliver dynamic access to empower and protect organizations worldwide. To that end, BeyondTrust is building a highly skilled global Cloud Security Specialist team. We are seeking an experienced identity expert to join our pre-sales go-to-market team. The Cloud security specialist supports the Sales Engineering and sales teams and will bring expertise and authority when addressing our customers' identity security needs.



What You’ll Do:


* Deliver customer-facing technical product presentations & demonstrations to audiences, including C-level executives.
* Assist Pre-Sales Solution Engineering team in customer-facing Proof of Value engagements, providing identity security subject matter expertise.
* Provide high-quality threat briefings, reports, and customer presentations. Showcase actionable intelligence the BeyondTrust Solution provides and discuss the importance, remediation options, and prevention strategies.
* Develop strong advisory relationships with customers. Help BeyondTrust customers understand the threats and attacks they are exposed to and how the BeyondTrust platform and other tools and practices are used to remediate identity-based threats.
* Speak intelligently and expertly with customers about BeyondTrust's Identity Security Insights Detections, and recommendations surfaced during an Insights assessment.
* Align Insights Detections and Recommendations with the existing BeyondTrust portfolio.
* Work alongside Sales and Solution Engineering as the Specialist/Advisor supporting customers throughout the opportunity lifecycle and beyond.
* Set aside time to investigate and research breach details, attack paths, and methods used by threat actors.
* Articulate the value of the BeyondTrust solution, conveying the importance of vigilant monitoring of privileged identities compared to the cost of a corporate breach.
* Collaborate with internal teams to detect new threats and mitigation tactics based on hunting observations.


What You’ll Bring:


* Experience in a fast-paced, technical sales environment.
* Applicants should have at least five years of experience in technical roles involving XDR, PAM or IAM, Active Directory, Azure AD, MFA, SSO.
* Ability to explain highly technical concepts to audiences with varying levels of technical knowledge.
* In-depth knowledge of Active Directory architecture, including authentication mechanisms and potential security threats.
* Competitive understanding of Identity Security and ITDR market and landscape.
* Understand Cloud Identity & Security (Multi-Cloud IAM Accounts, Roles, Policies, Entitlements…)
* Knowledge & understanding of modern threat attack methods, such as kerberoasting, MFA bombing…
* Ability to articulate MITRE ATT&CK techniques and corresponding TTPs.
* Experience with scripting languages such as Python and PowerShell.


Nice To Have:


* Background in application or cloud application development.
* Experience with infrastructure as code and automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Puppet...
* Experience in Cyber Security, Identity Management, and or Governance solutions.


Better Together



Diversity. Inclusion. They’re more than just words for us. They are the guiding values of how we build our teams, cultivate leaders, and create a culture where people feel connected.



We take care of our employees so they can take care of our customers. Customers who come from all walks of life just like us. We hire incredible people from diverse backgrounds because when we are different together, we are stronger together.



About Us



BeyondTrust is the worldwide leader in intelligent identity and access security, enabling organizations to protect identities, stop threats, and deliver dynamic access. We are leading the charge in innovating identity-first security and are trusted by 20,000 customers, including 75 of the Fortune 100, plus a global ecosystem of partners.

  



#LI-EC1

title: OCI Cloud Architect
description:
**Location:** **Remote**
------------------------

**Department:** **Cloud & Technology**
--------------------------------------

**Type:** **Full Time**
-----------------------

**Min. Experience:** **Experienced**
------------------------------------


  
### **Description**


The Cloud Architect will be engaging with various customers in their cloud enablement initiatives. The candidate will be involved in design and execution of cloud migration strategy, automating existing cloud workloads in cloud, provide services to port existing workloads to leverage cloud benefits. The ideal candidate will have deep experience in Public Cloud environments (preferably Oracle Cloud Infrastructure - OCI) with a specialty in running virtualized Linux/windows systems leveraging the latest technologies. Candidate will also exhibit the ability to communicate technical aspects of a solution to the customer.

**Requirements:**

**Location:** 100% Remote

* 10 plus years of experience as a technical specialist in Customer-facing roles.
* Ability to quickly pick up multi-cloud skills in major Public Clouds (OCI, Azure, AWS or GCP).
* Engage with various customers in blueprinting workloads and migration to cloud.
* Create cloud migration strategy as per the customer requirements.
* Demonstrate thought leadership and the appropriate application of technology.
* Define and develop cloud services roadmaps, reference architectures, standards, guidelines, and practices.
* Responsible to drive project completion through entire engagement cycle - pre-sales, design, migration/implementation
* Develop creative and innovative cloud solutions to business and technical problems.
* Collaborates with other architects to ensure the appropriate application of technology and ensure the fit of cloud services into the overall enterprise architecture
* Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
* Ability to communicate technical information effectively, both orally and in writing.
* Experience with any virtualized environment – VMware, Hyper-V, Oracle VM or KVM
* Deep knowledge and understanding of Linux and Windows-based systems administration skills in a Cloud or Virtualized environment.

 **Skills Preferred:**

* Strong scripting skills, i.e., Powershell, Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc is desired. Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewalling.
* Deep expertise in designing solutions around Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI).
* Strong understanding of storage, networking, filesystem layout is required.

title: Network Architect
description:
Hi,

Greetings from Zllius Inc!

We have an urgent opening for the role**Network Architect.** If interested, revert me back with your Updated resume, along with contact details, work authorization.

**Job Role: Network Architect**

**Location: Harrisburg area (Hybrid)**

**Duration: Long-term**

**Position: W2/1099**

**Visa: Any (Except H1B)**

**Job Ref: AUG80**

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Design and develop network architectures for on premise datacenters, cloud (public and private)
* Prepare and deliver training, documentation and network awareness activities to the Network Engineering and Operations teams
* Develop technical solutions to help mitigate observed gaps in current connectivity solutions and hardware platforms
* Align to widely accepted networking standards and frameworks with overall business and technology strategy
* Adapt networking architecture elements to adapt to new standards as they emerge
* Identify design gaps in existing and proposed networking architectures and recommend changes or enhancements
* Possess a firm understanding of the interconnectivity within and to VMware, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the Microsoft Azure platforms
* Be a strong technologist with pragmatic view and creative mind, and a natural collaborator with line of business architects, engineers, developers, application owners, service providers, and senior management

**Qualifications Network A**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
* In Lieu of undergraduate degree, the ratio is 1:1 meaning one year of work experience equals one year of college experience
* 7+ years of increasing responsibility architecting, positioning and delivering complex network engineering and architecture solutions. This includes but is not limited to multi-datacenter interconnectivity, WAN solutions based on carrier MPLS along with Internet-based DMVPN via all manner of Internet connection types
* Familiarity with public and private cloud connectivity technologies.
* Proven experience in design and operation of diverse enterprise networks

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Deep understanding of BGP routing within the context of carrier connectivity as well as internal systems connectivity along with redistribution techniques into and from other routing technologies like EIGRP.
* Experience with large wide area networks of 1000+ sites and migrations to Cisco SD-WAN from traditional connectivity types
* Strong hands-on technical abilities and attention to detail
* Deep understanding of Network design in various environments (LAN, WAN, Datacenter, Cloud)
* Demonstrated ability to assume independent and team-based responsibilities
* Strong teamwork, interpersonal and customer service skills a must
* Proven ability to lead and mentor others
* Strong communication skills a must; ability to read, write, and speak in a professional manner
* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills are essential
* Must possess a personal sense of urgency
* Ability to effectively multi-task and adapt to changing business priorities
* An understanding of firewall concepts (traditional and NextGen) and load balancing concepts a plus

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA and other federal, state, and local standards
* Sedentary work that involves sitting or remaining stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.
* Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard, and monitor

**Thanks & Regards:**

**Zllius Inc.**

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote
