title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
**Job Description**  

The Senior Cloud Architect is an individual contributor role responsible for the design, architecture, engineering, and standardization of all cloud infrastructure environments including storage, computer, networking, virtualization, automation systems, and all associated hardware and software solutions. The Senior Cloud Architect is also responsible for setting the strategic direction of cloud services spanning infrastructure, platform, and software as a service; ensuring standard designs and implementation processes are followed consistently throughout the organization. The goal at MasterBrand is to digitally transform core business capabilities; shedding outdated on-premises platforms for newer generation cloud services and to adopt a “cloud-first” approach to existing and emerging capabilities of the business.

**This is a remote-based position. Selected candidate must be able to conduct business during the Eastern or Central time zones. Preferred locations are in the Cleveland, OH / Deerfield, IL / or Jasper, IN areas.**

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop standards and processes for the design, standardization, engineering, implementation, and maximization of cloud services used across MasterBrand.
* Partner closely with cloud partners to understand changing technologies, designs, and landscapes to roadmap changes and ensure proper fit with company objectives and technology dependencies.
* Form strong partnerships with MasterBrand digital technology and business peers to understand requirements and, problems to solve, and to align with overall business strategies.
* Ensure that security and risk management is embedded in all cloud service designs, engineering solutions, and implementations to ensure adequate protection of digital assets and data used to operate MasterBrand’s business.
* Consistently seek opportunities to scale cloud solutions to maximize effectiveness and efficiency both from a performance and cost perspective.
* Operate as a subject matter expert, designer, engineer, implementer, and consultant to any initiatives related to cloud services used across the enterprise.
* Communicate clearly and concisely with a professional demeanor to all levels of the organization

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s Degree in MIS or Computer Science preferred, or relevant concentration, with a minimum of five (5) years of experience; or a minimum (7) seven years relevant and equivalent business or IT experience.
* Minimum of three (3) years of Azure service management including integration, identity, security, storage, virtualization, compute, messaging, and networking within the Azure platform.
* Minimum of three (3) years of traditional compute, application, identity, and network experience (e.g., traditional data center, recommend and implement security hardening technical controls)
* Preferably have one or more of the following certifications: CISSP, Azure AZ-104, AZ-500, or above,
* Strong understanding of security concepts including SIEM, EDR, Network, Cloud, and Data security technologies.
* Experience in leading technical aspects of project work, integrating between IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS, and consulting adjacent teams on best approaches to cloud adoption.
* Experience in migrating from traditional on-premise technologies to cloud platforms is required.
* Strong analytical, documentation and communication skills.

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Ability to motivate, lead, and positively influence team members
* A thoughtful leader with a collaborative leadership style, can-do attitude, and innovative mindset
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interact and build trust across all levels of the organization
* Ability to work in a complex matrix organization structure which include holding company and owned subsidiaries
* Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Strong leadership and change management skills
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy
* Strong communication skills – verbal, listening, written & presentation

**Culture:**

* Demonstrates trust in the process of lean methodologies and tools. Approaches situations through a fact-based lens. Analyzes data, draws conclusions, make recommendations, and present findings. Critically assesses and simplifies processes and controls, and challenge business drivers and risks.
* Embraces the team through strong interpersonal skills and the ability to relate to people at all levels of the organization, including diverse viewpoints. Seeks to understand and involves others in problem-solving. Proven track record of building a team and managing change.
* Moves forward through strong organizational and execution skills. Able to champion core issues, develop resourceful and creative solutions and drive results at all levels of the organization. Strong attention to detail and follow-through skills are a must. Ability to drive successful execution of strategic plans. Adaptable and flexible to changing business conditions and priorities.

  

**Additional Information**  

For nearly 70 years, MasterBrand has been shaping the places where people come together, enriching lives and creating meaningful memories for our customers. That, combined with our stylish products, expansive dealer and retail network, and dedicated associates, has helped make us the number one North American residential cabinet business. Our unique culture of continuous improvement is based on trusting the tools, empowering the team and moving forward, and is kept alive by our more than 14,000 associates across 20 plus manufacturing facility and offices. Visit www.masterbrand.com to learn more and join us in building great experiences together!

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


MasterBrand Cabinets LLC is an equal opportunity employer. MasterBrand Cabinets LLC’s policy is not to discriminate against any applicant or employee based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability/handicap status, marital status, military status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws. MasterBrand Cabinets LLC also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also MasterBrand Cabinets LLC’s policy to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws respecting consideration of unemployment status in making hiring decisions.

**Reasonable Accommodations**


MasterBrand Cabinets LLC is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you have a disability and wish to discuss potential accommodations related to applying for employment, please contact us at staffing@masterbrand.com.

* Actual pay will vary based on qualifications and other factors

title: AWS Solutions Architect
description:
DonorSearch is the leading provider of prospect research solutions and AI-powered technologies serving nonprofit organizations across the US. Headquartered in Maryland, with a primarily remote employee staff, DonorSearch proudly services over 7000 clients. The DonorSearch values include innovation, integrity, excellence, growth, collaboration, and delivering high-quality results.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Design and implement scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions on the AWS platform.
* Conduct a comprehensive audit of our current AWS stack and provide recommendations for improvement.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective AWS solutions.
* Utilize built-in AWS features and functionality to enhance system performance and reliability.
* Implement best practices for security, reliability, and performance in AWS environments.
* Work closely with development teams to ensure applications are designed with scalability and efficiency in mind.
* Identify opportunities for cost savings and optimization within our AWS infrastructure.
* Given the urgency, candidates with immediate availability will be given priority.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field preferred.
* Proven experience as an AWS Solutions Architect or a similar role.
* In-depth knowledge of AWS services, features, and best practices.
* Hands-on experience with cloud migration, automation, and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like CloudFormation or Terraform.
* Strong understanding of networking, security, and compliance in AWS environments.
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
* AWS certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional is a plus.

  

This full-time position has a base salary starting at $90,000 - $125,000. We offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) with company match, voluntary life insurance, paid time off, tuition reimbursement, teleworking opportunities, personal and professional development opportunities, and many more exciting perks.

title: DevOps Architect I, Cloud Migration
description:
Headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaii, with remote locations across the United States, RevaComm is a leader in Agile Software Development, User-Centered Design, Cyber Security, and DevSecOps. As an enterprise digital transformation company, we transform organizational challenges into powerful digital capabilities through fresh experiences and great technology. Grounded by the company's core values, our approach brings together digital business strategists and architects, software engineers, user experience designers, and project managers to create sustainable solutions for customers while surprising and delighting their users.


Our mission on the CMS team is to empower and protect the 60M+ American citizens who rely on the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services. We are ready for a challenge like none other. We are revolutionizing how government software solutions are built by leveraging modern, cloud-first technology in DevSecOps, Cybersecurity, and Kubernetes services.


We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Cloud Migration Engineer with extensive experience modernizing and doing lift and shift migrations from the data center to the cloud. This individual will serve as a subject matter expert on a team of cloud engineers tasked to help applications modernize and move to the cloud. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in supporting other teams migrate their application to the cloud. As a Senior Migration engineer your primary job will be assisting teams with architecture and engineering support for migrating and/or modernizing their application from an on-premises data center to AWS. This role requires in-depth technical expertise in common legacy data center architectures and of course experience in modern cloud architecture and software development. Given the consultative nature of this role, excellent communication and collaboration are a must have.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Team Leadership:
	+ **Be the subject matter expert and help lead a team of software developers and cloud engineers responsible for cloud migration projects.**
	+ Set clear goals, priorities, and expectations for the team.
	+ Mentor and coach team members, fostering their professional growth and development.
	+ Provide technical guidance, resolve conflicts, and ensure the team's successful performance.
* Application Assessment: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess existing applications, architecture, their dependencies, and requirements for migration to the cloud. Provide architecture suggestions to encourage the migration to our Kubernetes based Cloud PaaS (platform as a service).
* Application Architecture and Design: Assist application teams in modernization efforts by educating on and helping them design scalable and cost-effective cloud architectures that meet the unique needs of each application, as well as educating them on how best to utilize our PaaS.
* Development and Optimization: Assist and train your migration team to write, modify, and optimize code as needed to prepare applications for cloud migration, adhering to best practices for cloud development.
* Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Work with the PaaS SRE team, and the application team to set up monitoring and logging solutions to ensure the health and performance of applications, proactively identifying and addressing issues.
* Documentation: Write comprehensive documentation for migration processes, architecture designs, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing among teams.
* Training and Support: Provide training and support to other development teams to ensure a smooth transition to the cloud, offering guidance and assistance as needed.
* Security and Compliance: Collaborate with security teams to implement and maintain strong security measures and compliance standards within the cloud environment.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Senior Software Engineer with a focus on cloud migration projects.
* Proven experience in architecting a cloud native application hosted on k8s.
* Experience in supporting and migrating legacy applications to the cloud
* Expertise in programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, .NET) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with a variety of CI/CD tools and technologies, such as Jenkins, GitLab, Docker, Kustomize, Helm K8, etc.
* Strong proficiency in Infrastructure as code i.e.Terraform
* Strong proficiency with AWS
* Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD).
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills for working with diverse teams and stakeholders
* The ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with customers.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Familiarity with Websphere & JBoss
* Familiarity with Platform One: Big Bang
* Familiarity with K8s Automation Frameworks (FluxCD, ArgoCD)

**Join our 'Ohana**

*'Ohana* in Hawaiian translates to *"Family.*" But we understand it to mean more than one's relatives. It also includes those people you choose to surround yourself with. The 'ohana-oriented mindset is one of the pillars upon which our company has been built. You can find additional information about RVCM here.


At RVCM, we are committed to offering a comprehensive and competitive slate of benefits that prioritize our employee's overall well-being.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

**Salary Range:** **$160K - $190K**


As a Full-time RVCM employee, you can also expect these additional benefits:

* Fully remote work within the U.S.
* Exemplary Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
* Health Care and Dependent Care Savings Accounts
* Group Term Life Insurance auto-enrollment (for employees who participate in health insurance coverage with RVCM)
* 401(k) with company matching after 1 year of service. Accounts are 100% vested immediately
* **Universal Leave:** Accrue up to 15 days in your first year of service, increasing to 18 days between thirteen months and three years of service, 21 days between four and nine years of service, and 24 days after 10 or more years of service
* Eligible to roll over 240 hours annually
* A company-provided laptop plus a $1,000 Home Office Bonus upon hire.
* Paid parental leave for the care of a newborn or adopted child is compensated at 100% of the employee's regular, straight-time weekly pay.
* Healthcare FSA (Flexible Spending Account) for eligible medical expenses
* Dependent Care FSA (Flexible Spending Account) for eligible dependent care expenses
* Continuous Education and training, including financial support for acquiring certifications
* Mentorship Programs


We believe in providing a safe space for all members of the RVCM' ohana to grow and thrive. Our employees come from a broad spectrum of backgrounds, each with a unique story. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion are at the heart of who we are, and everyone should


feel valued and free to bring their most authentic self to work - without fear, without judgment. Creating this environment is essential not only for our organization but also for our customers and our communities.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

#### ***Salary Range: Negotiable, Based on Experience***

#### ***Relocation Expenses Not Covered***

title: S/4HANA Public Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
**About Sapphire** **Systems:**



Sapphire is the largest digital operating transformation provider to the mid-market and mid-enterprise clients. Our mission is to turn operating friction into digital business momentum. Through the passion and expertise of our people, we unlock the cloud-delivered operating platforms, digital user experiences, data analytics, and intelligent automation that transforms our client’s operational performance. We are globally significant partners for SAP, ServiceNow, Automation Anywhere, Infor, Hexagon and AWS, and we have transformed the digital operating capacity, capability, intelligence and resilience of over 1,250 clients in the UK and US through our portfolio of consulting, design, delivery, lifecycle service, and cloud services.  



  

**Job Summary:**



The Solutions Architect role is lead functional expert on the S/4HANA Cloud projects.



The services solution architect activity will involve agreeing estimates for project working with pre-sales – working with the project manager to kick off the project successfully - running design workshops/sessions with the client and line of business consultant to complete end to end design ‘blueprints’ and templates for implementation consultants to follow during the course of a project implementation. The solution architect also ensures successful end to end testing of the solution takes place.  



  

**Duties/Responsibilities:**


* Show cross functional expertise at a medium level across all lines of business and sap end-to-end processes with S/4HANA Cloud.
* Provide solution design and implementation guidance and expertise where required
* Show expertise in SAP Activate Methodology and the SAP CALM system.
* Undertake detailed consulting and design tasks as required on specific projects .
* Maintain in depth and up to date knowledge of relevant business drivers, typical customer needs and the ERP competitive landscape
* Ensure collaboration with industry presales teams, partners, the core technology presales community and sales.
* Attend adequate product training; read relevant collateral, analyst reports, white papers, competitive documents etc.
* Conduct solution design workshops and produce design documents for successful solution implementation to be followed and executed by the implementation team
  

  

**Required Skills/Abilities:**



To fulfil the role of Solutions Architect you will need to demonstrate the following attributes:



Technical:


* Demonstrable cross functional knowledge across the S/4 HANA solution set.
* Understand the Implementation methodology of S/4HANA Cloud.
* Working knowledge of at least two S/4 HANA Cloud modules.
* Good understanding of the general IT Business Solutions marketplace and landscape with particular emphasis on ERP
* Previous background in Solution Architecture.

Non-Technical:


* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Results driven
* Ability to work in (virtual) teams at all levels, across all time zones
* Self-motivation with a drive to learn and pick up new challenges
* Intellectual curiosity for technical innovation
**Education, Training and Experience:**


* At least 1 years S/4 HANA Public Cloud version
* Deep SAP S/4 HANA Knowledge - Profound expertise in SAP S/4 HANA, including its modules, functionalities, and best practices.
* In-depth understanding of S/4 HANA Public Cloud version, including its specific features and capabilities.
* Cloud Expertise - Extensive experience with cloud computing platforms, particularly SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud.
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure, deployment models, and cloud security practices.
* Strong consulting skills, including the ability to understand client needs and recommend suitable SAP S/4 HANA Public Cloud solutions.
* Experience in conducting workshops, presentations, and stakeholder meetings.

**Pay & Benefits:**



The salary range for this role is from $170,000-200,000 USD + a variable compensation component based on individual, team, and company performance metrics.



Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. As a remote-first company, we strive to consider each candidate's job-related skills, location, experience, relevant education or training to determine individual base salary. Your Global Talent Partner will share more about the specific salary range during the hiring process.

 **Benefits:**


* Generous leave policy. This includes your birthday off & a day off to volunteer
* 401K with 4% employer match after 1 year of employment
* 100% Medical/Dental/Vision coverage for the employee & 70% for dependents
* Basic/voluntary insurance and AD&D
* Long term disability leave
* Monthly wellness stipend

**Note to candidates:**

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Sapphire is unable to provide sponsorship to applicants for work visas.

title: Solutions architect
description:
**About:**
----------



Acclaro is a translation service and platform that helps the world’s leading brands succeed across cultures. Through a fine-tuned process, top industry talent and leading technologies, we make a long-term investment in our clients’ global brands.



Working in over 125 languages and with offices around the globe, Acclaro helps clients open new markets and gain a competitive edge by expertly adapting their brands and products with high-quality translations.


**Description:**
----------------



The Solutions Architect role collaborates across functions to understand stakeholder objectives and challenges to develop, implement and refine modern localization programs based on advanced technology.



This role requires a comprehensive understanding of the translation technology landscape, including, but not limited to, translation management systems, machine translation engines, automated QA technology, API integrations and the like. With your breadth of localization experience, you recognize the complexities inherent in demanding, enterprise programs and solutions required for success. Part of your responsibilities will be to design automated workflows and lead technical implementations that comprise a constellation of AI, MT, API and other technical elements.



You are an excellent communicator with the ability to advise and collaborate technical and non-technical stakeholders. Your consultative and solutions-oriented working style builds confidence and trust and contributes to Acclaro’s continued growth.


**Location:** Worldwide, remote  

**Reports to**: Global program director (PMO)


**Responsibilities:**
---------------------


* Lead meetings and communications with stakeholders to understand requirements and challenges as well as independently analyze data
* Develop solutions that are streamlined, scalable, and tailored to meet Acclaro’s corporate goals.
* Be an expert advisor to customers on localization and technology solutions
* Understand cutting-edge of localization technology and be passionate about researching the latest innovations to integrate into Acclaro workflows
* Stay current with the localization ecosystem, especially loc technology including CAT, TMS, and AI solutions
* Communicate key information to operations team members to assist with client onboarding and implementations
* Evaluate services for existing accounts; analyzing, automating, and streamlining workflows, delivery models, tools and language technology, etc.
* Mentor operations team members to drive efficiency and innovation; provide guidance on production solutions

**Requirements:**
-----------------


* 5+ years of relevant experience as a Solutions Architect, Technical Consultant, or in a similar role that focuses on technical solution design and implementation
* 2+ of Localization Industry experience
* Expert-level user of at least one of the following: Phrase, Lokalise, MemoQ, Transifex, XTM, RWS Language Cloud, or Crowdin.
* Analytical approach to complex problems
* Excellent communication skills to concisely synthesize complex information and provide clarity to both internal/external and technical/non-technical stakeholders
* Extensive knowledge of localization technology, tooling, workflows, and standards
* Curiosity and strong desire to stay current with new tools, processes, and concepts in the localization industry
* Familiarity writing, running and/or testing basic scripts
* Familiarity with researching APIs and communicating requirements

**Desirable:**
--------------


* Experience with translation business management programs such as Plunet
* Knowledge of content management systems and their localization frameworks (WordPress (WPML), Drupal (TMGMT), Contentful, Craft, Sitecore, AEM, etc)
* Knowledge of CMS integrations/workflows for localizing content
* Experience working at a remote-first, globally dispersed company


*Acclaro is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws. We make hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit and business needs at the time.*

title: AWS Cloud Architect
description:
As an AWS Solutions Architect at Commit, you will play a crucial role in designing and implementing scalable, secure, and cost-effective solutions for our clients' cloud-based infrastructure using AWS. You will work closely with prospects, clients, internal teams, and AWS resources to architect and deliver solutions that meet the client's business objectives and requirements.


Responsibilities:

* Solution Design: Collaborate with prospects and clients to understand their business needs, technical requirements, and existing infrastructure. Based on these, design and architect AWS-based solutions that align with industry best practices, security standards, scalability, and cost optimization.
* Technical Expertise: Demonstrate expertise in AWS services, architectures, and solutions. Keep up-to-date with the latest AWS technologies, trends, and best practices. Provide technical guidance and recommendations to clients and internal teams on leveraging AWS services effectively.
* Engagement & Collaboration: Engage with prospects and clients in pre-sales and post-sales activities, including requirements gathering, solution presentations, and technical discussions. Build strong relationships with clients, understanding their business challenges, and providing appropriate solutions to meet their needs. Develop and maintain relationships with AWS Solution Architect counterparts.
* Solution Implementation: Lead or support the implementation of AWS solutions, collaborating with cross-functional teams as needed. Ensure successful deployment of solutions, troubleshoot issues, and provide guidance on ongoing management and optimization.
* Security and Compliance: Design and implement solutions that adhere to industry-standard security practices and compliance requirements. Assess and mitigate potential security risks, recommending and implementing appropriate security measures to protect clients' data and systems.
* Documentation and Training: Create and maintain technical documentation, including solution architecture diagrams, deployment guides, and best practice documents.

  


Requirements:
  

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* 4+ years of experience with complex customer production environments
* At least 4 years working with AWS Cloud services
* Vast experience with Windows and Linux Operating Systems
* Vast Experience with Active Directory, IAM, Roles
* Well familiar with SSH, HTTPS, Certs, Encryption protocols, and implementation
* Extensive experience in designing and implementing AWS solutions, including a strong understanding of AWS services, such as EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, VPN, Network Segmentation, Security Groups, ELB, and ASG
* AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate or Professional level certification is strongly preferred.
* Demonstrated experience in solution design, architecture, and deployment of scalable and secure cloud-based solutions.
* Strong knowledge of networking concepts, security best practices, and cloud infrastructure architecture.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with clients, technical teams, and stakeholders.
* Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex technical issues and provide practical solutions.
* Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.
* Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Located in the Eastern or Central time zone of the US.
* Nice to Haves
* Well Experienced with either EKS/ECS/Elastic Beanstalk
* Experience with Automation provisioning using Terraform or Cloud Formation
* Experience with deployment tools either Jenkins/Ansible/Puppet/Code Pipeline
* Experience with Designing and Deploying High Available & Disaster Recovery Solutions
* Highly qualified in writing Design Documents, Procedures, Proposals
* Experience with software development

title: Solutions Architect - Agile Services
description:
### **Overview**



Thanks for your interest in Isos! Even though we are not hiring for this position at this time, we would love to keep in touch. Isos Technology is looking for an energetic, personable and agile-focused professional to join our team. The right candidate will be passionate about the challenges addressed by enterprise agility, long term planning, project management, portfolio planning as well as the best in class tooling in the Atlassian ecosystem that supports these practices. You are dedicated to meeting our clients where they're at and assisting them to assess and address gaps holding them back from deriving the maximum value from their Atlassian investments and hitting their business objectives. Engagements will include collaboration with the Agile Services team, including the Principle Agilist, analysts and consultants. You will work directly with our clients for effective delivery of Enterprise Agile at Scale tooling solutions like Jira Align as well as Big Picture and Advanced Roadmaps for those organizations still on the journey to enterprise-level tooling solutions. You are a self-starter who also values collaboration and is willing to give and receive input for the betterment of the team.


### **About Us**



Isos Technology accelerates the innovation curve for companies that are changing the world. As a premier Atlassian Platinum and Enterprise Solution Partner with ITSM, Cloud and Agile at Scale specializations, we make organizations’ Atlassian tools work more efficiently and effectively, with the least amount of disruption, so that our customers can focus on their business priorities. Since 2005, our Atlassian-certified team has tackled some of the toughest problems companies face across ITSM, Agile, DevOps, and Cloud and has helped hundreds of organizations in both private and public sectors get the most value out of their technology investment. Headquartered in Tempe, Arizona, and with offices across the U.S., Isos Technology has been recognized as an Atlassian Partner of the Year in both the ITSM and the Enterprise categories, an Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Private Company, and a CIOReview Most Promising Agile Consulting Company.


This role requires solid, practical experience with the techniques and approaches to guide, support and improve business outcomes with lean and agile concepts and methodologies, at scale and otherwise. The primary focus of this role is to:


* Create, present and implement solution designs for agile, portfolio & project management tooling solutions including, but not limited to:
	+ Jira Align
	+ Big Picture
	+ Advanced Roadmaps
	+ Structure / Tempo
	+ Atlas
	+ Jira Product Discovery
* Establish a valuable partnership with clients, building rapport quickly with a mix of your industry and tooling solutions expertise
* Participate in sales and marketing activities as needed, providing input for thought leadership and supporting content
* Help in the growth and efficiency of the Agile Services team, creating internal KB materials and tooling workshops / training

### **Duties and Responsibilities**


**Agile Tooling Solutions Expertise**



As an Agile Tooling Specialist, you are not only passionate about agile and popular practices and frameworks, but also the technology that enables transparency, collaboration and improved decision making.


* Serve as an Agile Tools Subject Matter Expert; advise clients and internal teams on best practices, guidelines and related recommendations
* Architect, present and implement technical solutions that align with client requirements and business objectives. Enable adoption of the implemented solution.
* Collaborate with our Agile Services team as needed to ensure that your recommended tooling solutions are tailored to both the near and long term objectives for adopting agile practices and achieving their top business goals.
* Continuous learning regarding Agile, Scrum, coaching, facilitating, emotional intelligence, team dynamics, active listening for self and team, etc.


**Engagement Delivery**


* Maintain a client billable workload of 80%
* Manage engagement scope in terms of budget and resource constraints; identify and manage risks and escalate blocking issues as needed
* Conduct yourself with Clients and Teammates consistent with Isos Values and consulting standards

### **Qualifications**


**Experience**


* 4 years experience in the development and delivery of agile focused tooling solutions
* Expertise with Enterprise Agile Portfolio Management: Jira Align or related agile at scale enterprise software solution experience such as IBM, Rally, Clarity, VersionOne, AgileCraft, Planview. As well as additional related agile and project management technology solutions such as: Jira, Atlas, Jira Product Discovery, Aha, Roadmunk, Advanced Roadmaps, Big Picture, Structure, Miro, Mural, Smartsheets, Tempo
* Expertise with the principles of agile, agile at scale, lean, project management, long term planning and portfolio management
* Experience with launching and supporting Lean Portfolio Management teams and practices
* Agile Certifications such as CSM or PSM or SAFe SM, SPC


**Skills:**


* Strong Communication skills – Strong English written, and oral skills required
* Quickly understand business needs and related requirements
* Create and deliver presentations that clearly communicate recommendations
* Ability to organize and manage multiple engagements
* Ability to lean into challenging conversations when needed, showing care for our clients while setting clear expectations
* Ability to adjust approach as appropriate: facilitation, mentoring, coaching, teaching, training, consulting
* Skilled facilitator with the ability to engage others such that working sessions, retrospectives, assessments, presentations, are received as highly valued
* Ability to facilitate interactive, executive-level leadership workshops and deliver meaningful feedback and assessments

 *This position is primarily a work from home position and we consider applicants throughout the United States. We support pay transparency, and the Arizona compensation range for this position is between* *$80,000 - $142,000* *plus eligibility for the company bonus program, a suite of employee benefits, paid time off, and a 401(k) plan. Actual compensation can vary based on qualifications, experience, and geographic pay differentials.*


*Isos Technology is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, color, age, physical or mental disability, spousal affiliation, marital status, a serious medical condition, genetic information, veteran status or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, or local law.* Candidates must be willing to participate in and successfully pass a background check and pre-employment drug testing and be authorized to work in the United States. HyperVelocity Consulting is an E-Verify participating employer.

  

E-Verify Participation Notice: https://e-verify.uscis.gov/web/media/resourcesContents/E-Verify\\_Participation\\_Poster\\_ES.pdf



E-Verify Right to Work: https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/IER\\_RightToWorkPoster%20Eng\\_Es.pdf

title: Remote Oracle Financial Cloud Solutions Architect
description:

* Strong experience with Chart of Accounts and Enterprise Structures design.

title: SRE Engagement Lead
description:
Reference For full time Hire. Experienced Enterprise Platform Architect with advanced knowledge in the following key areas:
  
  

* Deployment Architecture (performance, monitoring, operations),
* Benchmarking (Agile, program managements, network management),
* Design (compliance, security),
* Network Engineering (planning, provision).


Experience to lead the transformation of clients through technology by leveraging your knowledge and curiosity of current and future enterprise technologies, methods and approaches. Enable clients to navigate and scale adoption of New IT methodologies and operating models that drive business agility e.g.: Systems Reliability Engineering, scaled Agile frameworks, DevOps, lean architecture. Inspire clients with vision and understanding the art of the possible. Facilitate workshops to engage clients in Delivery and Operational operating models, and transformation governance.
  
  

Develop business opportunities that bring innovative technology solutions to a client's ways of working. Focus on building trusted relationship with senior client stakeholders, influencing corporate strategy, and building supporting vision documents. Develop business opportunities by creating strategic innovative technology solutions that transforms and enhances our client's technology offering.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Enable clients to navigate and scale adoption of New IT methodologies and operating models that drive business agility using SRE, Agile frameworks, DevOps etc.
* Define client's Delivery, Operational and Governance transformation strategy and roadmaps
* Conduct interviews with different stakeholders, across the organization
* Contributes to thought leadership through the participating in the development of support processes/procedures.
* Contributes to the definition of the client's Delivery, Operational and Governance transformation strategy and roadmaps
* Conduct client DevOps capability assessments and providing industry subject matter expertise on topics like agile, DevOps, SRE, lean delivery
* Create and facilitate workshops to engage clients to define future state roadmaps and models, and transformation governance
* Collaborates with team members to ensure consistency of delivery, adherence to standard practices, and continuous improvement.
* Provides training and mentoring for teams to ensure that process guidelines are understood and followed
* Lead client DevOps capability assessments and providing industry subject matter expertise on topics like agile, DevOps, SRE, lean delivery
* Create and facilitate workshops to engage clients to define future state roadmaps and models, and transformation governance
* Develop business opportunities that bring innovative technology solutions to a client's ways of working
* Focus on building trusted relationship with senior client stakeholders, influencing corporate strategy, and building supporting vision documents.
* Design and direct all aspects of Continuous Delivery implementation
* Advise, lead and work on high impact activities within the systems development lifecycle, and provide advisory across IT.


**Skills and Experience Requirements:**  

* 15+ years advising, scoping and delivering transformative technology services within Banking, Capital Markets, or Insurance industries.
* 5 years+ managing an SRE (or related) team that operates in a public cloud (AWS), highly distributed environment is preferred
* Experience in managing a release pipeline, from planning to deployment to monitoring impact
* Thorough understanding of what may drive business priorities, strategy and direction.
* Comprehensive understanding of ITIL practices, and in-depth understanding of customer requirements around IT operations. ITIL certification is preferred
* Ability to work well in a cross-functional, matrix management environment with a highly collaborative, team-oriented approach to problem solving
* Strong interpersonal skills to facilitate meetings and communicate complex concepts. Strong communication, negotiation, and relationship building skills
* Understanding of technical infrastructure delivery processes with the ability to adjust and apply this knowledge in a dynamic environment
* Previous experience building a new SRE team from the ground up and progressively increasing the team's responsibilities by coaching the team through the process of on-boarding services into the team
* A passion for SRE/DevOps principals and a clear drive to remove toil and run highly resilient/automated systems
* Experience with DevOps, Continuous Delivery, and related tools, such as GitHub, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, or equivalents.
* Experience in an Agile delivery environment
* Experience as a hands-on software engineer so you understand the core principles of the engineering work
* Experience supporting customer problems and communication
* Experience or interest in speaking/presenting at tech conferences.
* Experience in communication and organization in large, distributed teams
* A Bachelor's degree is required


Consulting Experience is a plus.

title: Infra Cloud Architect (AWS / Azure)
description:
#### **Introductie**


For our end-user client in the area of **Utrecht** we are looking for an experienced **Freelance Infra Cloud architect.**  

  

Deadline: ASAP  

Startdate: ASAP  

Duration: 31-12-2021 months (with option to extent)  

Location: **Mainly remote** (client location is Utrecht)  

Lanuage: Dutch and English speaking!


#### **Organisatie**


Our client is a front running learning and media company impacting the lives of millions every day.

  

#### **Functie**


The Cloud Architect works closely with the business it-teams and our suppliers to support them in the fast changing and growing **digital learning and media** areas and supports the **merger- and acquisitions related to Cloud services**.  

  

What do you do all day? In short…..  

– you have a **key role** in the mergers- and acquisitions, not only on a technical and architect level but also building the necessary relationships with the internal customers and suppliers which are highly familiar with **Amazon Web Services and other Cloud Platforms**.  

–have a proven track record of delivering results in digital service development as well as operations management.  

– advise our third parties and internal customers on the **AWS and Azure** products and services.  

– will support some of the AWS Cloud service technologies and services, e.g monitoring solutions, cloud security products and log management.


#### **Functie-eisen**


* a relevant higher education level and/or relevant experience.


– relevant AWS architect certifications. Nice to have are AWS security certifications and Azure architect/security certifications.  

– worked 3+ years in design and implementation with public cloud based solutions.  

– Knowledge of common software used in enterprises, such as Active Directory, Sql Server, SAP and Citrix.  

– are experienced with networking principles, architectures and topologies, both in the cloud and on-premise is a requirement.  

– Experience with automation such as powershell, bash, cloud formation and terraform.  

– also have good documentation, presentation and communications skills in English and Dutch The workplace and team will provide you with:  

– a great possibility to be part of leading digital media and learning service development and operations.  

– a working place in Amersfoort, which will give you an opportunity to work with great colleagues.  

– a challenge for yourself while supporting our business to be on top of digital services.
#### **Inlichtingen**


Michel Koning 06-34657362

title: Project Architect
description:
At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We’re not just designers. We’re tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems. Whether you’re into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationship in global markets, there’s something here for everyone.
Our depth of expertise spans disciplines—from aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we’re refreshing a retailer’s brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.
Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.
As the world’s largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.
Your Role
As a Project Architect you will need to coordinate with a team of consultants to deliver architectural projects. Leverage your industry experience and technical insight to drive client projects from concept through build. You need to actively participate in all phases of the project phases including documentation and construction administration. Innovative thinking balanced with ability to present real-world technical solutions to new design challenges. Must thrive with personal responsibility and accountability but embody and embrace open communication and team-oriented success.
What You Will Do* Manage all phases of projects, from project documentation set-up and construction administration.
* Manage project scheduling, budgets, and set-up with clients, sub-contractors, vendors and consultants. Management of related costs by supervising project developments and skills in clash detection with digital tools.
* Guarantee the delivery of the architectural and/or technical aspects of a project.
* Provide project team coordination, specification, and material selections required for construction.
* Resolution of complex technical and design issues as they arise during document preparation and construction administration
* Manage a range of project team sizes, comprised of consultants, project architects, interior designers and job captains
* Preparing and ensuring accuracy of technical documents
* Participating in preconstruction phases, RFIs and value engineering.
* Participating in the construction administration of project assignments, including quality control and submittal reviews,
* Working with consultants, contractors, fabricators and regulatory agencies to meet overall project objectives
* Produce architectural drawing
* Conduct site inspections.
* Manage client, team and project coordination, including full documentation coordination with structural, MEP, lighting, AV, landscape civil consultants and/or involved parties.
* Support communication between project team, clients, vendors, contractors, consultants, and building and permitting officials
* Provide technical guidance and innovative solutions to resolve complex technical and design challenges
* Review technical documents to ensure accuracy.
* Oversee the construction administration of project assignments with focus on managing design intent and quality control. Ability to maintain design integrity, construction quality and supervision of materials that meet international standards.
* Lead coordination with contractors, fabricators and regulatory agencies to ensure constructed project meets overall project objectives.
* *Able to perceive or prevent risks in any part of the process*
* Other assigned responsibilities.


Your Qualifications* Bachelor of Architecture or foreign equivalent
* 5+ years of experience in the profession of architectural design
* Proficiency in REVIT, Sketch Up, and construction administration software's.
* 100% bilingual English/Spanish, well written with excellent verbal communication skills
* Working knowledge of national and international building codes, standards, building construction, and building structures
* Mid-scale to large construction experience
* Experience with the entire project lifecycle, through post-occupancy
* Strong leadership, communication and relationship management skills
* Construction documentation and/or design detail development experience
* Ability to handle difficult situations with tact, grace and emotional intelligence.
* Experience leading, managing and mentoring multiple project teams
* Proven fiscal accountability and responsibility on various project types
* Must have the ability to maintain existing client relationships and build new client relationships
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong organizational skills


Your Design Technology Qualifications*Essential:** Deep understanding and expertise in Autodesk Revit for design authoring, documentation, data extracts and project delivery.
* Deep understanding and expertise in the strategic planning, setup of BIM projects, and troubleshooting, specifically in the context of Revit and allied workflows.
* Deep understanding and expertise with collaboration in the BIM context, including cloud-based markups, consultant coordination and clash detection.
* Understanding of the capabilities and application of Information Management tools such as Aconex, Asite, Newforma, etc.

*Desirable:** Good working knowledge and experience in Rhinoceros for design authoring.
* Good knowledge and experience with interoperability workflows between Rhino & Revit throughout all the stages of a project.
* Good knowledge and experience with real-time rendering processes, and material creation & management within the context of integrated BIM and parametric workflows.
* Good knowledge and experience with Computational Design applications such as Grasshopper and/or Dynamo.
* Good knowledge and experience with simulation principles and processes, including interpretation, and application of results. Familiarity with Performance Design applications such as Autodesk Insight, Sefaira, and Ladybug tools.
* Good knowledge and experience in the use of VR walkthroughs and panoramas for client presentations, consultant coordination and internal design reviews.

*Applications we work with:** Design Authoring - Revit, Rhino, Autocad, Navisworks
* Collaboration - BIM360
* Computational Design - Grasshopper, Dynamo
* Building Performance Simulation - Insight, Sefaira, Diva, Ladybug tools
* Visualisation – Vray, Enscape, Twinmotion, 3DSMax
* Graphics & Productivity - Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office Suite
* Experiential – Unreal Engine, Unity
* Development – C#, Python


To be considered, please submit portfolio and/or work samples in PDF format.
Life at Gensler
Gensler Asia-Pacific and Middle East is committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion through our Five Strategies. In partnership with our clients, we strive to create a just and equitable future for our communities and our colleagues. We celebrate our diversity and are focused on creating an inclusive workplace environment for all.
As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.
We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.
As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Software Architect
description:
We need the Technology Evangelist to work with our sales teams, build trust with our clients and teams, establishing strong rapport as a trusted advisor, and build an environment where our clients feel (and are) secure.  



**Your Impact**

* Raises awareness of and builds a mass of users for specific technology, products or services.
* Provide credible thought leadership about the value of your technology
* The work encompasses many aspects of business, including sales, marketing and leadership & aiming to establish emerging technology as an industry standard.
* Establish yourself as a trusted advisor to prospects and customers working with your Account Manager and the local partners within your territory.
* Having in-depth knowledge about various technology, applications, products and services that will provide valuable insight about the customer, competitors and industry as a whole.
* Architect and propose validated solutions which address the identified cybersecurity problems in each individual environment
* Identify and document specific problems with prospective and current customers which can be solved through the deployment of integrated solutions
* Understand and effectively differentiate against our top competitors.
* Be a highly competent presenter, with a proven track record in selling to C level executives
* Facilitate communication on strategic and tactical issues facing our clients and partners
* Maintain continuity and up-to-date knowledge of industry trends, technical developments, and governmental regulations that affect target markets
* Develop market strategies and goals for each product and service; understand the strategies, goals, and objectives of accounts
* Extensive domestic travel and possible International travel as necessary.

**Your Experience**

* BSCS or equivalent
* 15+ years of experience as a successful SE (Pre Sales) or Systems Integrator
* Experience of handling large BFSI customers in India acting as a Security Consultant.
* Strong understanding of Indian Banking industry, Regulatory requirements & Security concerns.
* Prior experience selling network infrastructure based security appliances including but not limited to: Firewalls, SSL/IPSec VPNs, Security Proxies and Web Application Firewalls etc.
* Prior experience of selling modern day security products including but not limited to : Next Generation Firewalls, APT solutions, NGIPS, WFH, Public & Private Cloud Security etc.
* Good understanding of DC & Virtualization Technologies such as : Vmware, Vmware NSX, Cisco ACI, KVM & Openstack.
* Understand and effectively present our security platform to technical and non-technical audiences
* Experience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networking (L2 Switching architectures including Spanning Tree, IP routing including OSPF and BGP, L4 Load balancing)
* Experience selling, demonstrating, installing and troubleshooting network infrastructure security products and SDWAN solutions.
* Strong interpersonal and very strong presentation skills, both verbally and written
* Ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution
* Ambitious attitude and motivation to assist in closing a deal in a timely manner
* Significant industry certifications (SANS, CISSP, CCIE, etc) will be a plus.

title: Software Architect
description:
Principal Architect List of mandatory tools/technology GitHub, GitHub copilot Terraform, terragrunt Ansible, AAP Sonar Qube Azure DevOps AWS and Azure Azure DevOps Datadog, Splunk, Grafana, Prometheus Docker, Kubernetes, helm charts Responsibilities: Design, implement and manage DevOps systems and tools that enable the organization to deploy software quickly and reliably. Collaborate with development teams to design and implement continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines. Develop and maintain automated deployment scripts and infrastructure as code. Implement and maintain monitoring and logging solutions to ensure The availability and performance of the systems. Evaluate and implement new DevOps technologies and tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organizations Software delivery pipeline. Collaborate with stakeholders to define and implement security and Compliance standards for DevOps systems. Mentor and coach other DevOps engineers and developers in best Practices for DevOps processes and tools. Provide guidance and expertise on system options including identifying the risks, impact, cost and benefits Create requirements and development forecasts and accurate planning for the timely completion of projects Skill Sets (Must have): Education qualification: BE/B Tech/MCA/MSc/M. Tech. 10 to15 years of experience in DevOps, with a focus on designing and Implementing CI/CD pipelines, DevOps Automation Processes, and Monitoring. Must be a certified Solution Architect Professional/DevOps Engineer Professional Extensive experience with DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, Azure DevOps, Monitoring, Self-Healing Services. Strong experience with infrastructure as code (laC) tools such as CloudFormation, Terraform, etc. Experience with public cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. Excellent scripting skills with languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell. Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch, Familiarity with security and compliance frameworks such as SOC 2, HIPAA, PCI, and GDPR. Good to have DevSecOps experience. DevOps assessment and recommendation thought process. ARM Template and Terraform. Have AZ -104/400/AWS Solution Architect Certification. Very strong verbal & written communication skills. Skill Sets (Preferred): Experience with container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes and Docker Swarm. Experience with Infrastructure as Code (laC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Ansible. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and software engineering practices such as TDD, BDD, and pair programming. Experience with Service Mesh technologies such as Istio, Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to Collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical Stakeholders**About Virtusa**



Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. When you join us, you join a team of 30,000 people globally that cares about your growth — one that seeks to provide you with exciting projects, opportunities and work with state of the art technologies throughout your career with us.



Great minds, great potential: it all comes together at Virtusa. We value collaboration and the team environment of our company, and seek to provide great minds with a dynamic place to nurture new ideas and foster excellence.



Virtusa was founded on principles of equal opportunity for all, and so does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Software Architect
description:
Are you passionate to work as a ServiceNow Solution Architect. Than this is the position which you should apply! We are looking for ServiceNow Solution Architect who will report into Director ServiceNow Support & Delivery to process of redefining from legacy IT services to modern cloud and digital solutions to fuel continued company growth.
What will you be doing?* Your will contribute and will be encouraged to provide technical product and architecture advice, ongoing communication of the latest ServiceNow solutions/capabilities and assisting build practices that deliver outstanding outcomes.
* Working as ServiceNow solution architecting and delivering critical solutions across all workflows, on the ServiceNow Platform.
* Able to convey enterprise architecture knowledge/experience regarding how ServiceNow can best interoperate and co-exist with other major enterprise systems of record and platforms.
* Drive innovative business solutions and digital transformation. Architect and develop innovative solutions in collaboration with a multi-functional team.
* Collaborations in the team is fast-paced and requires strong collaboration along with multi-functional and cross geographical teams.


What will you need to be successful?* Education: Bachelor's or equivalent experience or Master’s degree in Facilities or a relevant field.
* Certifications: ServiceNow CSA, Implementation certifications (minimum ITSM) Minimum ITLT Foundation.
* Experience: Deep Technical knowledge of ServiceNow platform to provide domain expertise and perspective on outstanding use cases. Knowledge of multiple ServiceNow modules like ITSM, HRSD, SPM, GRC.
* Proficiency in third party integrations using Integration hub, rest APIs, JDBC, and file-based parsers.
* Validated understanding of ServiceNow, proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, and libraries/frameworks such as AngularJS and Bootstrap.
* Ability to quickly understand new technology through instruction and self-training.
* Strong people development skills, including coaching and mentoring for technical roles
* Strong detailed domain expertise within multiple areas of specialization.
* Consult with Collaborators to understand their business needs and difficulties. Document and present technical solutions. Provide mentoring to colleagues in the organization.
* Superb communication, collaboration, and relationship building and collaborator engagement skills.
* Travel Requirements: <10%

Other reasons why you will love it here!* Your Future: Major Medical coverage + Policy exclusions and insurance non-medical limit. Educational Assistance.
* Work/Life Balance: Flexible Personal/Vacation Time Off, Privilege Leave, Floater Leave.
* Your Wellbeing: Parents / Parents in Law’s Insurance (Employer Contribution of 7,000/- annually), Employee Assistance Program, Parental Leave.
* Flexibility: Hybrid Work Model (For most professional roles)
* Training: Hands-On, Team-Customized, Mentorship

An automation architect is typically a member of an IT team that is responsible for aligning automation processes, tools, and strategies with business goals. * Exposure to SuccessFactors Integration (SAP CPI, BTP)


* Worked with SuccessFactors SFAPI, ODATA API, and CompundEmployee API


* Knowledge of SuccessFactors Integration Center

title: Development Operations Engineer
description:
**We help the world run better**


Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**  

  

You will work in the context of the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) which provides the multi-cloud foundation and a layer of abstraction for all applications to run on both public clouds (AWS, Azure, GCP, AliCloud) and private cloud. More specifically you will work on a specific technical Backing Service, the Object Store as a service, a highly available, durable and scalable objectstore space to customers for storing and managing their objects.

* Design, code, test and assure quality of complex product features with team members
* Resolve complex issues within own area of expertise and supports others
* Work in multi-cloud environment within DevOps setup.
* Use Infrastructure as Code methodologies to automate and manage infrastructure and services
* Learn new technologies/patterns and incorporate into the product with minimal disruption.
* Perform self-code review and peer review.
* Define and formulate coding best practices and guidelines for clean code
* Initiate, collaborate and inculcate positive development practices into an agile team
* Work with architects in design and delivering robust, secure cloud-native applications

 **WHAT YOU'LL BRING**


Excellent university degree (bachelor, diploma, master, PhD) in computer science or related engineering discipline

* 9 to 13 years of relevant industry experience
* **Mandatory**:
* Sound understanding of cloud-native architecture, development, design and cloud platforms
* **Excellent knowledge of software design patterns including microservices and integrated systems.**
* Excellent hands-on proficiency in Java 8+, Spring boot and possibly Go
* **Experience running systems on container-based platforms (Kubernetes and/or Cloud Foundry)**
* Confidence working within Unix / Linux shell environments with focus on BASH/Python for automating scripting
* IaaS experience with at least one of AWS, Azure, GCP
* Experience working with CI/CD
* Excellent communication and interpersonal"s skill
* Experience and willingness to work in a project setup following agile principles and practices
* Fluency in English (written and spoken) and sound presentation skill
* Willingness in guiding and mentoring software developers
* Experience in 360-degree software delivery practices

 **MEET YOUR TEAM**


The BTP Core Backing Services team is comprised by single Scrum teams embedded into an international context, all contributing to the SAP Business Technology Platform. As a cloud platform development team we design, develop, automate, integrate, operate and supports thoroughly crafted, resilient, secure, scaling and well-essayed backing services built on open source, hyperscaler platform technology or SAP technology. We are dedicate to agile development practices. You will be the perfect match for our team if you fulfill the above profile and also favors to innovate, influence and have an impact, and if you remain eager to learn and improve while also relishing and being apt to mentor and engage others.

 **We build breakthroughs together**


SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 386483 | Work Area: Software-Design and Development | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.

title: Software Architect
description:
Solution Architect – Secure Networking – India
Gurgaon / NCR


**Job Description**

As a member of the Subject Matter Expert (SME) Engineering Department, you will work closely with the Account Team to position our Portfolio of Secure Networking Solutions consisting of NAC, Wireless, Switches, Identity and Access Management(AAA), and Voice solution components, drive field Systems Engineers (SE) in their projects and report product evolution requests to Consulting Systems Engineering (CSE) team.


**Responsibilities:**

* Member of the SME team which covers India region (India & SAARC Region)
* Expected to work from the office three days per week. This enables collaboration with the extended teams, fostering trusted relationship and teamwork.
* Second level of pre-sales support assisting the field SE organization:
	+ in responding to RFPs/RFIs: design, solution specification, product information.
	+ in supporting key projects to ensure Fortinet's success.
	+ in leading technical discussions, articulating the technology and demonstrating differentiated value.
	+ in conducting compelling solution presentations, demonstrations and POC (Proof of Concept).
	+ Hands on assistance
* Responsible for building technical materials to support sales activities (slideware, solution brief, white papers, success stories, technical notes, competitive comparison etc.) and designing Internal workshops.
* Perform External workshops & PoCs for prospects or customers on product evaluations and do demonstrations, in collaboration with Account SE.
* Perform hands-on tests to validate network designs, customer proof-of-concept setups and network deployments for new products and feature.
* Effectively disseminate product knowledge to the Sales Team and Channel.
* Point of contact for the CSE team: responsible to report and consolidate customer needs across India region, validate business cases, write, and escalate feature requests.
* Report project activities, analyze project trends and provide market vision.
* Participate in the development of commercial strategies.
* Ability to Travel at a short notice, as required within India region.
* Collect information on competitive solutions, products, and services and update the Channel and Account team

**Requirements:**

* At least 10 years of experience in a Senior SE, Consulting SE, Technical role within the Networking or IT Security industries.
* Vendor and SI experience.
* Expertise in designing, proposing, demonstrating and conducting Proof of Concept for Network Access Control (NAC) solution to customers
* Experience with Wireless technology, design, site survey, implementation, and troubleshooting.
* Proficiency in designing and proposing DataCenter, Campus and Branch switching solutions
* Experience in Identity and Access management solutions(AAA) solutions related to NAC, Wireless and switches.
* Knowledge of pitching ZTNA technology, SD-Branch
	+ Switching: VXLAN, MCLAG, ACL’s, QOS, Port Security(802.1x authentication), Stacking. IEEE 802.1Q VLAN Tagging, IEEE 802.3af/at/bt, PoE budget calculations, IEEE 802.3ad/ax/ae, LLDP/MED/MAC Sec, STP, RADIUS CoA, DHCP Snooping, IEEE 802.3z/ab/ae/az/bz/ba/bg/bm, Split port, Port Fast, Private VLAN, Storm Control, LoopGuard, IEEE 802.1ad QinQ, IGMP/Dhcp snooping.
* Strong fundamental understanding of TCP/IP(IPv6), Switching, WLAN, Network Security and Authentication
* Advanced Technical understanding of Routing Protocols, specifically OSPF & BGP
* Experience in IP Voice solutions would be an added advantage.
* Hands-on experience in NGFW / UTM / Threat prevention
* Knowledge in some of the following areas of specialization:
* Basic knowledge of MDM solutions, IoT solutions, MAC Address Bypass, LAN Micro-segmentation, SNMP, MIB OIDs etc
* Wireless: Must have deep understanding in IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ax/be, IEEE 802.11e/h/i/k/r/v, CAPWAP, BLE/Zigbee, EAP-TLS, EAP-TTLS/MSCHAPv2, PEAPv0/EAP-MSCHAPv2, PEAPv1/EAP-GTC, EAP-SIM, EAP-AKA, EAP-FAST, WPA™, WPA2™, and WPA3™ with 802.11, Wireless Controller Architecture (campus and remote AP deployment), Basic understanding of Wireless spectrum analyser and WIPS, OFDMA, Spatial Reuse, UL MU-MIMO, DL- MU-MIMO.
* AAA: RADIUS and LDAP Authentication, Certificate based authentication for wired and wireless deployment, SAML authentication, Single Sign-On User Identification Methods, Two-factor authentication, Onboarding techniques of BYOD and IOT devices.
* IPSec Encryption, Basics on IPv6, Multicast, NAT, VRF, VoIP, QoS, LTE/5G, Packet Capture/Analysis Tools, SSL/TLS.
* Scripting knowledge using Python / Bash / PowerShell / Golang or alternative
* Administrative knowledge of Linux
* Knowledge of Public Cloud concepts in technologies like GCP, Azure and AWS
* Knowledge of Private Cloud concepts in technologies like VMWare and KVM
* Strong presentation skills to executives & consulting skills
* Demonstrate extensive hands-on level skills in deploying and troubleshooting complex networks
* Setup labs to learn and evaluate new technologies
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* A self-motivated, independent thinker.
* An ability to manage multiple tasks and opportunities by prioritizing them efficiently, generate product demand at a large scale and be self-motivated.
* Must be a team player and have exceptional communication skills.
* Bachelor’s Engineering degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electronics, Computer Application or equivalent experience in network security industry.

Fortinet is an equal opportunity employer.
  

We will only notify shortlisted candidates.
  

  

Fortinet will not entertain any unsolicited resumes, please refrain from sending them to any Fortinet employees or Fortinet email aliases. Should any Agency submit any resumes to Fortinet, these resumes if considered, will be assumed to have been given by the Agency free of any related fees/charges.
